texts.label: text
texts.orig: For 'Full Sourcing Projects', the 'Project Owner' opens the 'Technical Envelopes' for initiating the  technical  evaluations.  The  'Team  Graders'  receive  a  system-generated  email  when  the 'Technical Envelopes' are opened.
texts.text: For 'Full Sourcing Projects', the 'Project Owner' opens the 'Technical Envelopes' for initiating the  technical  evaluations.  The  'Team  Graders'  receive  a  system-generated  email  when  the 'Technical Envelopes' are opened.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Team Graders' must review and agree to the Confidentiality Requirements and No Conflict of Interest before conducting the technical evaluation. These requirements are provided within the 'Review Conflict of Interest and Perform Technical Evaluation' task description.
texts.text: The 'Team Graders' must review and agree to the Confidentiality Requirements and No Conflict of Interest before conducting the technical evaluation. These requirements are provided within the 'Review Conflict of Interest and Perform Technical Evaluation' task description.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case a "Team Grader" does not agree to the Confidentiality Requirements and No Conflict of Interest, a valid reason for the same is provided to the "Project Owner' via the comments section in the task. The 'Team Grader' leaves the task un-attempted in this case.
texts.text: In case a "Team Grader" does not agree to the Confidentiality Requirements and No Conflict of Interest, a valid reason for the same is provided to the "Project Owner' via the comments section in the task. The 'Team Grader' leaves the task un-attempted in this case.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In such cases, the "Team Grader" is replaced by the "Project Owner" upon recommendation of the respective function head. Replacement of the "Team Grader" is endorsed by the Head of Procurement , outside 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: In such cases, the "Team Grader" is replaced by the "Project Owner" upon recommendation of the respective function head. Replacement of the "Team Grader" is endorsed by the Head of Procurement , outside 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Confidentiality Requirements and No Conflict of Interest are deemed accepted (automatically) by the 'Team Graders' when they complete the 'Review Conflict of Interest and Perform Technical Evaluation' task.
texts.text: The Confidentiality Requirements and No Conflict of Interest are deemed accepted (automatically) by the 'Team Graders' when they complete the 'Review Conflict of Interest and Perform Technical Evaluation' task.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Following methods are provided in 'SAP Ariba' to conduct technical evaluations:
texts.text: Following methods are provided in 'SAP Ariba' to conduct technical evaluations:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Grade by Content enables grading of each response, across Suppliers , within 'SAP Ariba'; this method may be used for comparative grading across Suppliers responses.
texts.text: Grade by Content enables grading of each response, across Suppliers , within 'SAP Ariba'; this method may be used for comparative grading across Suppliers responses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Grade by Participants enables grading of responses, one Supplier at a time .
texts.text: Grade by Participants enables grading of responses, one Supplier at a time .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Grade Offline Using Excel enables grading in an excel spreadsheet, outside 'SAP Ariba'
texts.text: Grade Offline Using Excel enables grading in an excel spreadsheet, outside 'SAP Ariba'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Technical  Evaluation  within  'Sourcing  Module'  is  based  on  the  'Scoring  Methodology' defined in the Sourcing Event.
texts.text: The  Technical  Evaluation  within  'Sourcing  Module'  is  based  on  the  'Scoring  Methodology' defined in the Sourcing Event.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: In case of  an  RFI  event,  the  Sourcing  Event  evaluation  may result  in  a  list  of 'Screened and Shortlisted Suppliers' for subsequent Sourcing Events.
texts.text: Important Note: In case of  an  RFI  event,  the  Sourcing  Event  evaluation  may result  in  a  list  of 'Screened and Shortlisted Suppliers' for subsequent Sourcing Events.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  case  of  a  two-stage  evaluation,  once  the  technical  evaluation  is  completed,  the  'Project Owner' opens the 'Commercial Envelopes' for technically qualified Suppliers . The commercial evaluation  is  conducted  by  the  'Project  Owner',  engaging  the End-user and  the Finance, if required.
texts.text: In  case  of  a  two-stage  evaluation,  once  the  technical  evaluation  is  completed,  the  'Project Owner' opens the 'Commercial Envelopes' for technically qualified Suppliers . The commercial evaluation  is  conducted  by  the  'Project  Owner',  engaging  the End-user and  the Finance, if required.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' may engage the 'Team Graders' to conduct the commercial evaluation, when recommended by the PDoA.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' may engage the 'Team Graders' to conduct the commercial evaluation, when recommended by the PDoA.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: In case of 'Quick Sourcing Project' the Sourcing Event evaluation is managed outside 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: Important Note: In case of 'Quick Sourcing Project' the Sourcing Event evaluation is managed outside 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' shortlists Suppliers for negotiations and create a 'Negotiations Bidders List Request' based on the technical and commercial evaluations.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' shortlists Suppliers for negotiations and create a 'Negotiations Bidders List Request' based on the technical and commercial evaluations.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner', in collaboration with the End-User or Tendering Committee , develops a 'Negotiation Plan' to conduct negotiations. The 'Negotiation Plan' is a document detailing (but not  limited to)  the  purpose,  the  target,  and  the  proposed methodology  of  negotiations. The document provides details of the negotiation strategies that may be used.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner', in collaboration with the End-User or Tendering Committee , develops a 'Negotiation Plan' to conduct negotiations. The 'Negotiation Plan' is a document detailing (but not  limited to)  the  purpose,  the  target,  and  the  proposed methodology  of  negotiations. The document provides details of the negotiation strategies that may be used.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Documents' tab of the 'Sourcing Project' contains a 'Negotiation Plan' document which may be downloaded, completed, and uploaded by the 'Project Owner'. Below is the structure of this document:
texts.text: The 'Documents' tab of the 'Sourcing Project' contains a 'Negotiation Plan' document which may be downloaded, completed, and uploaded by the 'Project Owner'. Below is the structure of this document:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' may use the 'Negotiation Plan' template provided in the 'Sourcing Project' or other approved template covering the required elements.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' may use the 'Negotiation Plan' template provided in the 'Sourcing Project' or other approved template covering the required elements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' establishes a team to conduct negotiations. A 'Negotiations Team' may include  (but  not  limited  to)  Lead  Negotiator,  Summarizer,  Observer,  Minutes  Taker,  Subject Matter Expert, Financial Analyst, and Legal Advisor. The 'Negotiations Team' is encouraged to:
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' establishes a team to conduct negotiations. A 'Negotiations Team' may include  (but  not  limited  to)  Lead  Negotiator,  Summarizer,  Observer,  Minutes  Taker,  Subject Matter Expert, Financial Analyst, and Legal Advisor. The 'Negotiations Team' is encouraged to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Identify  the  Maximum Supportable Situation (MSS), Least Acceptable Solution (LAS), and Best Alternative to Negotiated Agreement (BATNA).
texts.text: Identify  the  Maximum Supportable Situation (MSS), Least Acceptable Solution (LAS), and Best Alternative to Negotiated Agreement (BATNA).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Collect and analyze industry and competitor information.
texts.text: Collect and analyze industry and competitor information.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Make a list of the most critical arguments and understand the points of leverage.
texts.text: Make a list of the most critical arguments and understand the points of leverage.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Plan the details of the negotiations and conduct internal trial runs, if required.
texts.text: Plan the details of the negotiations and conduct internal trial runs, if required.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important  Note:  An  individual  can  perform  multiple  roles  within  the  'Negotiations  Team'  (if required). The 'Negotiations Team' must consist of a minimum of two members.
texts.text: Important  Note:  An  individual  can  perform  multiple  roles  within  the  'Negotiations  Team'  (if required). The 'Negotiations Team' must consist of a minimum of two members.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  'Project  Owner'  invites  identified Suppliers for  negotiations  via  the  'Message  Board' functionality.  Post-negotiations,  if  an  agreement  is  reached  between  the Supplier and  the Procurement ,  the  'Project  Owner'  publishes  the  post  negotiation  Sourcing  Event  to  record updated Supplier responses.
texts.text: The  'Project  Owner'  invites  identified Suppliers for  negotiations  via  the  'Message  Board' functionality.  Post-negotiations,  if  an  agreement  is  reached  between  the Supplier and  the Procurement ,  the  'Project  Owner'  publishes  the  post  negotiation  Sourcing  Event  to  record updated Supplier responses.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In cases an agreement cannot be reached post-negotiations, the 'Project Owner' may take one of the following approaches:
texts.text: In cases an agreement cannot be reached post-negotiations, the 'Project Owner' may take one of the following approaches:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. If  the  original  bids  are  acceptable,  the  'Project  Owner'  proceeds  to  the  'Approve Recommendation of Award' task considering the original bids.
texts.text: If  the  original  bids  are  acceptable,  the  'Project  Owner'  proceeds  to  the  'Approve Recommendation of Award' task considering the original bids.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. If the original bids are unacceptable, the 'Project Owner' cancels the Sourcing Event. The 'Project Owner' may modify the 'Sourcing Strategy' or just conduct another Sourcing Event, to obtain the desired results.
texts.text: If the original bids are unacceptable, the 'Project Owner' cancels the Sourcing Event. The 'Project Owner' may modify the 'Sourcing Strategy' or just conduct another Sourcing Event, to obtain the desired results.

texts.text: The 'Project Owner' can create a post-negotiations Sourcing Event in following ways:

texts.orig: a. Using additional Sourcing Event in the original 'Sourcing Project' As recommended in Reverse Auction (eAuction), the 'Project Owner' may use the additional Sourcing  Event  within  the  'Full  Sourcing  Project'  to  obtain  negotiated  bids  from  the Suppliers.
texts.text: Using additional Sourcing Event in the original 'Sourcing Project' As recommended in Reverse Auction (eAuction), the 'Project Owner' may use the additional Sourcing  Event  within  the  'Full  Sourcing  Project'  to  obtain  negotiated  bids  from  the Suppliers.

texts.text: The 'Project Owner' may create an additional 'Quick Sourcing Project' (linked to the original SR) for Suppliers to provide negotiated bids. This is done by creating another 'Subproject' from the 'Documents' tab of the associated 'Sourcing Request'.

texts.orig: In  case,  an  additional  Souring  Event  within  the  original  'Full  Sourcing  Project'  is  used  for recording negotiated bids in 'SAP Ariba', the 'Project Owner' completes all activities specified in Prepare and Publish Sourcing Event for a 'Full Sourcing Project'.
texts.text: In  case,  an  additional  Souring  Event  within  the  original  'Full  Sourcing  Project'  is  used  for recording negotiated bids in 'SAP Ariba', the 'Project Owner' completes all activities specified in Prepare and Publish Sourcing Event for a 'Full Sourcing Project'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case an additional 'Quick Sourcing Project' is created to record post-negotiations bids in 'SAP Ariba', the 'Project Owner' completes all activities specified for 'Quick Sourcing Projects' in Create 'Sourcing Project' and Prepare and Publish Sourcing Event.
texts.text: In case an additional 'Quick Sourcing Project' is created to record post-negotiations bids in 'SAP Ariba', the 'Project Owner' completes all activities specified for 'Quick Sourcing Projects' in Create 'Sourcing Project' and Prepare and Publish Sourcing Event.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In either case, the 'Project Owner' may download the content of the original Sourcing Event and upload it in the new Sourcing Event. The Sourcing Event content can be modified in the new Sourcing Event, as required.
texts.text: In either case, the 'Project Owner' may download the content of the original Sourcing Event and upload it in the new Sourcing Event. The Sourcing Event content can be modified in the new Sourcing Event, as required.

texts.text: In case that the negotiations were not conducted, the 'Project Owner' creates the 'Award Recommendation Report' after the Sourcing Event evaluation and attach it along with the 'Award Scenarios' for approval by the 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA .

texts.text: In case negotiations were conducted, the 'Project Owner' creates the 'Award Recommendation  Report'  post-negotiations  and  attaches  it  along  with  the  'Award Scenarios' for approval by the 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Creating 'Award Scenarios' is the process to allocate the line items to winning Suppliers in 'SAP Ariba'. This allocation follows through to 'Contract Workspace' and to 'Procure to Order (P2O) module' (once enabled).
texts.text: Creating 'Award Scenarios' is the process to allocate the line items to winning Suppliers in 'SAP Ariba'. This allocation follows through to 'Contract Workspace' and to 'Procure to Order (P2O) module' (once enabled).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case the 'Bid Console' functionality is used, the 'Project Owner' can define a criterion in 'Bid Console' to automatically allocate line items to the successful Suppliers . Alternatively, the  'Project  Owner'  may  allocate  line  items  manually.  A  line  item  may  be  split  among winning Suppliers if required. Please refer to section 10.22 of the Procurement Standards to understand how to resolve a tie among Suppliers .
texts.text: In case the 'Bid Console' functionality is used, the 'Project Owner' can define a criterion in 'Bid Console' to automatically allocate line items to the successful Suppliers . Alternatively, the  'Project  Owner'  may  allocate  line  items  manually.  A  line  item  may  be  split  among winning Suppliers if required. Please refer to section 10.22 of the Procurement Standards to understand how to resolve a tie among Suppliers .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: Approval of 'Awards Scenarios' is mandatory for 'Sourcing Project' completion in 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.orig: The completed 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report' are approved by the 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA . 'Approval' tasks are initiated in 'Sourcing Module' once all predecessor tasks are 'Completed'.
texts.text: The completed 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report' are approved by the 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA . 'Approval' tasks are initiated in 'Sourcing Module' once all predecessor tasks are 'Completed'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If 'Approvers' reject the 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report', they must provide  a  valid justification  to  the  'Project  Owner'.  The  'Project  Owner'  makes  the
texts.text: If 'Approvers' reject the 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report', they must provide  a  valid justification  to  the  'Project  Owner'.  The  'Project  Owner'  makes  the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: recommended modifications and re-submits the 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report' for approval.
texts.text: recommended modifications and re-submits the 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report' for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As soon as the 'Approvers' approve the 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report', the 'Sourcing Project' automatically closes for any further modifications.
texts.text: As soon as the 'Approvers' approve the 'Awards Scenario' and the 'Award Recommendation Report', the 'Sourcing Project' automatically closes for any further modifications.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Once the 'Award Scenarios'  are  'Approved',  'SAP  Ariba'  can  automatically  send  a  systemgenerated email to  the  winning Suppliers, providing  them  with  the  details  of  the  line  items awarded to them. The 'Project Owner' needs to enable this automated email when creating the 'Award Scenarios'.
texts.text: Once the 'Award Scenarios'  are  'Approved',  'SAP  Ariba'  can  automatically  send  a  systemgenerated email to  the  winning Suppliers, providing  them  with  the  details  of  the  line  items awarded to them. The 'Project Owner' needs to enable this automated email when creating the 'Award Scenarios'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' tracks the acceptance/rejection of the award by winning Suppliers . In case the winning Suppliers reject the award, the 'Project Owner' may take one of the following steps:
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' tracks the acceptance/rejection of the award by winning Suppliers . In case the winning Suppliers reject the award, the 'Project Owner' may take one of the following steps:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: a. Consider the next eligible Supplier for award
texts.text: a. Consider the next eligible Supplier for award

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' can create another 'Quick Sourcing Project' (linked to the same SR) where the next eligible Supplier is invited to provide final bids. Please refer to section 2.3.3. (VIII)-(2.3.3.(VII)ii) for the details of the process.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' can create another 'Quick Sourcing Project' (linked to the same SR) where the next eligible Supplier is invited to provide final bids. Please refer to section 2.3.3. (VIII)-(2.3.3.(VII)ii) for the details of the process.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' cancels this Sourcing Event and modifies the 'Sourcing Strategy'. The Sourcing Events are created and executed following the newly approved 'Sourcing Strategy' to fulfil the requirements.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' cancels this Sourcing Event and modifies the 'Sourcing Strategy'. The Sourcing Events are created and executed following the newly approved 'Sourcing Strategy' to fulfil the requirements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The selected way forward is endorsed by the Head of Procurement .
texts.text: The selected way forward is endorsed by the Head of Procurement .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: If a 'Bid Bond Certificate' has been provisioned in the Sourcing Event, the "Project Owner" must inform the Finance to appropriate the Bid Bond for winning  Suppliers who have rejected  the  award.  The  'Project  Owner'  may  recommend adding  such  Suppliers  to  the list of blacklisted Suppliers in the Supplier Master Database maintained by the DGS.
texts.text: Important Note: If a 'Bid Bond Certificate' has been provisioned in the Sourcing Event, the "Project Owner" must inform the Finance to appropriate the Bid Bond for winning  Suppliers who have rejected  the  award.  The  'Project  Owner'  may  recommend adding  such  Suppliers  to  the list of blacklisted Suppliers in the Supplier Master Database maintained by the DGS.

texts.text: The  Contract  Lifecycle  Management  (CLM)  process  group  consists  of  procedures  associated  with creation, management, and closure of contracts.

texts.orig: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the CLM processes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The CLM process group interacts with the Supplier Performance and Relationship Management (SPRM) process group (to evaluate supplier performance against the contract) and the Requisition to Pay (R2P) process group (to manage associated downstream activities). Details of these processes are provided in 2.5 and 2.6 , respectively.
texts.text: The CLM process group interacts with the Supplier Performance and Relationship Management (SPRM) process group (to evaluate supplier performance against the contract) and the Requisition to Pay (R2P) process group (to manage associated downstream activities). Details of these processes are provided in 2.5 and 2.6 , respectively.

texts.orig: The  CLM  process  group  is  enabled  through  the  "SAP  Ariba  Contract  Lifecycle  Management  (CLM) module". Each contract associates to a 'Contract Workspace' (in the 'CLM module') which has predefined 'Tasks', 'Team Members', 'Documents', and approval chains configured to enable efficient creation and management of any contract.
texts.text: The  CLM  process  group  is  enabled  through  the  "SAP  Ariba  Contract  Lifecycle  Management  (CLM) module". Each contract associates to a 'Contract Workspace' (in the 'CLM module') which has predefined 'Tasks', 'Team Members', 'Documents', and approval chains configured to enable efficient creation and management of any contract.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Publish  Contract enables the creation, review, approval, and publishing of the contract in the 'Contract  Workspace'.  The Manage Contract enables  the  management  of  contract  amendments, claims, penalties, and disputes that may arise during the lifecycle of the contract. The Close Contract enables the closure/termination of the 'Contract Workspace' and completion of associated tasks.
texts.text: The Publish  Contract enables the creation, review, approval, and publishing of the contract in the 'Contract  Workspace'.  The Manage Contract enables  the  management  of  contract  amendments, claims, penalties, and disputes that may arise during the lifecycle of the contract. The Close Contract enables the closure/termination of the 'Contract Workspace' and completion of associated tasks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A Contracting Specialist/Lead is assigned as the "Project Owner" of the 'Contract Workspace'. For a 'Contract Workspace' created against an Entity-Specific Category, the 'Project Owner' is from the Entity managing the category. For a 'Contract Workspace' created against a Common Category, the 'Project Owner' is from the GPO. The 'Contract Workspace' for call-off contract (executed pursuant to the Common Category) is created and managed by the Entity executing the same.
texts.text: A Contracting Specialist/Lead is assigned as the "Project Owner" of the 'Contract Workspace'. For a 'Contract Workspace' created against an Entity-Specific Category, the 'Project Owner' is from the Entity managing the category. For a 'Contract Workspace' created against a Common Category, the 'Project Owner' is from the GPO. The 'Contract Workspace' for call-off contract (executed pursuant to the Common Category) is created and managed by the Entity executing the same.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'CLM module' enables the 'Project Owner' to organize contracts into hierarchies where a master agreement (also known as framework agreement) is the parent to one or more subagreements (also known as call-off contract). The stand-alone agreement is a contract that is not part a contract hierarchy and is executed by the Entity for its own requirements. Below is an illustrative example of contract hierarchy:
texts.text: The 'CLM module' enables the 'Project Owner' to organize contracts into hierarchies where a master agreement (also known as framework agreement) is the parent to one or more subagreements (also known as call-off contract). The stand-alone agreement is a contract that is not part a contract hierarchy and is executed by the Entity for its own requirements. Below is an illustrative example of contract hierarchy:

texts.orig: The 'Documents' tab of the 'Contract Workspace' contains a 'Contract Folder'. The 'Contract Folder' is the key document folder that is shared with the 'Reviewers' and 'Approvers' at every stage. It may contain the following documents, depending upon the nature of the contract:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Main Contract Document' is the legal document that defines the basis of the contract, including both parties' roles, responsibilities, and  a detailed description of the work. The 'Main Contract Document' could be the master agreement, sub-agreement or stand-alone agreement. The 'Project Owner' may use the 'Main Contract Document' templates provided in  'SAP  Ariba  Contracting  Library'  or  other  approved  template  covering  the  required elements.
texts.text: The 'Main Contract Document' is the legal document that defines the basis of the contract, including both parties' roles, responsibilities, and  a detailed description of the work. The 'Main Contract Document' could be the master agreement, sub-agreement or stand-alone agreement. The 'Project Owner' may use the 'Main Contract Document' templates provided in  'SAP  Ariba  Contracting  Library'  or  other  approved  template  covering  the  required elements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: The 'Main Contract Document' may include the provision for a Performance Bond for the Supplier. Please refer to section 1.5 to review the exceptions to the Performance Bond.
texts.text: Important Note: The 'Main Contract Document' may include the provision for a Performance Bond for the Supplier. Please refer to section 1.5 to review the exceptions to the Performance Bond.

texts.text: The 'Contract Claim/Penalty/Dispute Logging Form' provides details of the raised claim/penalty/dispute. This document is available in 'Contract Folder' tab once the contract claim/penalty/dispute tasks are triggered.

texts.text: Important Note: To publish a contract in the 'Contract Workspace', the 'Project Owner' must upload the 'Main Contract Document' and 'CLID', for review and approval. The 'Project Owner' may upload additional reference documents in the 'Contract Folder', if required.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All 'Review' tasks are performed uniformly across the 'Contract Workspace'. Below are the key activities for any 'Review' task:
texts.text: All 'Review' tasks are performed uniformly across the 'Contract Workspace'. Below are the key activities for any 'Review' task:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Step  1 -  The  'Project  Owner'  initiates  a  'Review'  task  by  providing  a  'Due  Date'  to  the 'Reviewer'.
texts.text: Step  1 -  The  'Project  Owner'  initiates  a  'Review'  task  by  providing  a  'Due  Date'  to  the 'Reviewer'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Step  2 -  The  'Reviewer'  opens  the  'Contract  Folder',  and  downloads  and  reviews  all required documents.
texts.text: Step  2 -  The  'Reviewer'  opens  the  'Contract  Folder',  and  downloads  and  reviews  all required documents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Step 3 - The 'Reviewer' uploads the modified 'Contract Folder' documents (only in case of modifications) and clicks on 'Complete Review' with additional comments/attachments if required.
texts.text: Step 3 - The 'Reviewer' uploads the modified 'Contract Folder' documents (only in case of modifications) and clicks on 'Complete Review' with additional comments/attachments if required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Step 4 - The 'Project Owner' reviews the updated documents in the 'Contract Folder'. In case of modifications, the 'Project  Owner' may 'Accept All changes' or initiate another round of review. The latest version of the documents gets saved in the 'Contract Folder' (automatically) when the 'Project Owner' clicks on 'Accept All changes'.
texts.text: Step 4 - The 'Project Owner' reviews the updated documents in the 'Contract Folder'. In case of modifications, the 'Project  Owner' may 'Accept All changes' or initiate another round of review. The latest version of the documents gets saved in the 'Contract Folder' (automatically) when the 'Project Owner' clicks on 'Accept All changes'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. Step 5 - The 'Project Owner' marks the specific 'Review' task 'Complete' and initiates the next task.
texts.text: Step 5 - The 'Project Owner' marks the specific 'Review' task 'Complete' and initiates the next task.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the 'CLM module', review by the Contract Administrator , the 'Supervisor' ( Contracting Lead or Procurement Manager) , and the Supplier are mandatory. The review with the Supplier is managed through a 'Negotiation' task, where the Supplier can either 'Accept Proposal' or 'Propose Counter Proposal' and attach modified documents.
texts.text: In the 'CLM module', review by the Contract Administrator , the 'Supervisor' ( Contracting Lead or Procurement Manager) , and the Supplier are mandatory. The review with the Supplier is managed through a 'Negotiation' task, where the Supplier can either 'Accept Proposal' or 'Propose Counter Proposal' and attach modified documents.

texts.orig: All 'Approval' tasks are performed uniformly across the 'Contract Workspace'. Below are the key activities for any 'Approval' task:
texts.text: All 'Approval' tasks are performed uniformly across the 'Contract Workspace'. Below are the key activities for any 'Approval' task:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Step 1 - The 'Project Owner' initiates an approval by providing a 'Due Date'.
texts.text: Step 1 - The 'Project Owner' initiates an approval by providing a 'Due Date'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Step  2 -  The  'Approver'  opens  the  'Contract  Folder',  and  downloads  and  reviews  all required documents.
texts.text: Step  2 -  The  'Approver'  opens  the  'Contract  Folder',  and  downloads  and  reviews  all required documents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Step 3 - The 'Approver' approves/denies the documents and provides comments/ attaches modified documents within the 'Approval' task.
texts.text: Step 3 - The 'Approver' approves/denies the documents and provides comments/ attaches modified documents within the 'Approval' task.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Step  4 -  In  case  the  'Approver'  has  denied  the  documents  (with  recommended changes/justification), the 'Project Owner' makes necessary changes and saves an updated version of documents in the 'Contract Folder'.
texts.text: Step  4 -  In  case  the  'Approver'  has  denied  the  documents  (with  recommended changes/justification), the 'Project Owner' makes necessary changes and saves an updated version of documents in the 'Contract Folder'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. Step 5 - If  the 'Project Owner' believes that the modified documents require review by 'Reviewers', the 'Project Owner' re-triggers specific 'Review' tasks.
texts.text: Step 5 - If  the 'Project Owner' believes that the modified documents require review by 'Reviewers', the 'Project Owner' re-triggers specific 'Review' tasks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. Step 6 -  In  case  the  review  by  the  'Reviewers'  is  not  required, the  'Project Owner' retriggers the 'Approval' task.
texts.text: Step 6 -  In  case  the  review  by  the  'Reviewers'  is  not  required, the  'Project Owner' retriggers the 'Approval' task.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g. Step 7 - If the 'Approver' approves the documents, the 'Contract Folder' moves to the next 'Approver' in the chain automatically, and Step 2 - Step 6 are repeated.
texts.text: Step 7 - If the 'Approver' approves the documents, the 'Contract Folder' moves to the next 'Approver' in the chain automatically, and Step 2 - Step 6 are repeated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: h. Step 8 -  Once all  approvals are completed, the status of the 'Approval' task changes to 'Completed', automatically.
texts.text: Step 8 -  Once all  approvals are completed, the status of the 'Approval' task changes to 'Completed', automatically.

texts.orig: Important Note: Each 'Review' tasks is specific to a 'Reviewer', whereas an 'Approval' task is a single task with a chain of 'Approver'' designated as per the PDoA.

texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' obtains signatures on two hard copies of the 'Main Contract Document' from authorized signatories, starting with the Supplier . Obtaining signatures is an offline process. The 'Project Owner' uploads a scanned copy of the signed 'Main Contract Document' in the 'Contract Folder' and marks the task 'Complete'.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' obtains signatures on two hard copies of the 'Main Contract Document' from authorized signatories, starting with the Supplier . Obtaining signatures is an offline process. The 'Project Owner' uploads a scanned copy of the signed 'Main Contract Document' in the 'Contract Folder' and marks the task 'Complete'.

Upon completing this activity, the 'Project Owner' confirms that the status of the contract is 'Published'. Only a 'Published' contract can be used for the Requisition to Pay (R2P) processes.

texts.orig: The  'Administrative'  amendments  do  not  have  associated  'Review'  and  'Approval'  tasks.  The 'Project Owner' can directly make 'Administrative' amendments and publish without any review or approvals. On the other hand, selecting 'Amendment', 'Renewal/Extension', or 'Termination' type of amendments  creates  pre-defined  'To  Do',  'Review',  and  'Approval'  tasks  in  the  'Contract Workspace', which are referred to as amendment tasks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An amendment request is raised either by the Supplier or the Contract Administrator . In either case, the Contract Administrator confirms the validity of the amendment before the 'Project Owner' initiates respective tasks in 'Contract Workspace'. The Contract Administrator reviews the  amendment with the Budget Owner to  ensure  the  necessary  budget  is  available  for  the proposed amendment. This validation of the amendment is managed outside 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: An amendment request is raised either by the Supplier or the Contract Administrator . In either case, the Contract Administrator confirms the validity of the amendment before the 'Project Owner' initiates respective tasks in 'Contract Workspace'. The Contract Administrator reviews the  amendment with the Budget Owner to  ensure  the  necessary  budget  is  available  for  the proposed amendment. This validation of the amendment is managed outside 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  the amendment is invalid, it is communicated to respective stakeholders, and any relevant query is resolved. In case the amendment is valid, and the budget availability is confirmed, the Contract  Administrator communicates  the  details  of  the  amendment  and  asks  the  'Project Owner' to initiate the amendment tasks.
texts.text: If  the amendment is invalid, it is communicated to respective stakeholders, and any relevant query is resolved. In case the amendment is valid, and the budget availability is confirmed, the Contract  Administrator communicates  the  details  of  the  amendment  and  asks  the  'Project Owner' to initiate the amendment tasks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  'Project  Owner'  initiates  an  amendment  through  the  'Overview'  tab  and  selects  the suitable amendment type. Following are the types of the contract amendments enabled in 'SAP Ariba':
texts.text: The  'Project  Owner'  initiates  an  amendment  through  the  'Overview'  tab  and  selects  the suitable amendment type. Following are the types of the contract amendments enabled in 'SAP Ariba':

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  case  of  'Administrative'  amendment,  the  'Project  Owner'  can  modify  the  'Overview' information and the 'Team Member' and publish the contract directly through the 'Overview' tab, without any reviews or approvals.
texts.text: In  case  of  'Administrative'  amendment,  the  'Project  Owner'  can  modify  the  'Overview' information and the 'Team Member' and publish the contract directly through the 'Overview' tab, without any reviews or approvals.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  case  of  'Termination'  amendment,  the  'Project  Owner'  reviews  and  completes  the 'Termination Checklist' first. The 'Project Owner' may use the checklist provided in 'Contract Workspace' or other approved template covering the required elements.
texts.text: In  case  of  'Termination'  amendment,  the  'Project  Owner'  reviews  and  completes  the 'Termination Checklist' first. The 'Project Owner' may use the checklist provided in 'Contract Workspace' or other approved template covering the required elements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: The 'Termination Checklist' ensures that the termination is justified. It does not address relevant activities to be completed to close contract. These activities are provided in the 'Contract Closure Checklist' and are explained in section 2.4.3.(VIII)ii.2)
texts.text: Important Note: The 'Termination Checklist' ensures that the termination is justified. It does not address relevant activities to be completed to close contract. These activities are provided in the 'Contract Closure Checklist' and are explained in section 2.4.3.(VIII)ii.2)

texts.orig: Review with the Supplier is managed in the 'Contracts Workspace' through a 'Negotiation' task, where  the Supplier can  either  'Accept  proposal'  or  'Propose  Counter  Proposal'  and  attach modified documents.
texts.text: Review with the Supplier is managed in the 'Contracts Workspace' through a 'Negotiation' task, where  the Supplier can  either  'Accept  proposal'  or  'Propose  Counter  Proposal'  and  attach modified documents.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If required, the 'Project Owner' may arrange a meeting with the Supplier to discuss and resolve the claim/penalty/dispute, in collaboration with the Contract Administrator, the Legal and the Finance.
texts.text: If required, the 'Project Owner' may arrange a meeting with the Supplier to discuss and resolve the claim/penalty/dispute, in collaboration with the Contract Administrator, the Legal and the Finance.

texts.orig: In case the 'Expiration Date' of the contract approaches (before all contractual obligations are met), the 'Project Owner' may extend the 'Expiration Date' to allow the Supplier to meet all contractual obligations, provided such an extension is requested by Contract Administrator and has been duly approved. If relevant provisions exist in the contract, the 'Project Owner' may renew the contract after obtaining required approvals.
texts.text: In case the 'Expiration Date' of the contract approaches (before all contractual obligations are met), the 'Project Owner' may extend the 'Expiration Date' to allow the Supplier to meet all contractual obligations, provided such an extension is requested by Contract Administrator and has been duly approved. If relevant provisions exist in the contract, the 'Project Owner' may renew the contract after obtaining required approvals.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The process for 'Extension/Renewal' amendment is explained in section 2.4.3.(IV).
texts.text: The process for 'Extension/Renewal' amendment is explained in section 2.4.3.(IV).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case the contract is not to be renewed or extended, either the 'Project Owner' closes the 'Contract Workspace', or the 'Contract Workspace' automatically expires as per the initially set 'Expiration Date' (irrespective of the incomplete contractual obligations).
texts.text: In case the contract is not to be renewed or extended, either the 'Project Owner' closes the 'Contract Workspace', or the 'Contract Workspace' automatically expires as per the initially set 'Expiration Date' (irrespective of the incomplete contractual obligations).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  'Contract  Closure  Checklist'  contains  a  comprehensive  list  of  activities  to  be  completed before  the  contract  is  expired  or  closed.  The  'Project  Owner'  can  download  the  'Contract Closure  Checklist'  document  from  the  'Documents'  tab  of  the  'Contract  Workspace'.  The 'Project Owner' completes and uploads the 'Contract Closure Checklist' in the 'Contract Folder' along with any relevant documents.
texts.text: The  'Contract  Closure  Checklist'  contains  a  comprehensive  list  of  activities  to  be  completed before  the  contract  is  expired  or  closed.  The  'Project  Owner'  can  download  the  'Contract Closure  Checklist'  document  from  the  'Documents'  tab  of  the  'Contract  Workspace'.  The 'Project Owner' completes and uploads the 'Contract Closure Checklist' in the 'Contract Folder' along with any relevant documents.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case of 'Termination' amendment or contract early closure, the 'Project Owner' proceeds to modify the contract 'Expiration Date' and close the 'Contract Workspace' as required.
texts.text: In case of 'Termination' amendment or contract early closure, the 'Project Owner' proceeds to modify the contract 'Expiration Date' and close the 'Contract Workspace' as required.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: There are no 'Reviews' and 'Approval' tasks for contract closure and expiry. The 'Reviews'  and  'Approval'  tasks  for  'Termination'  amendment  are  already  covered  in  Section 2.4.3.(IV).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Supplier Performance and Relationship Management (SPRM) process group consists of procedures to segment, manage relationships and performance of Suppliers .
texts.text: Supplier Performance and Relationship Management (SPRM) process group consists of procedures to segment, manage relationships and performance of Suppliers .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the SPRM processes.
texts.text: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the SPRM processes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Below is an illustration of SPRM Level 3 processes:
texts.text: Below is an illustration of SPRM Level 3 processes:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The SPRM processes are grouped into three distinct stages, enabled either through an 'SAP Ariba module'  or  managed  offline.  Below  is  an  illustration  of  these  stages  and  respective  'SAP  Ariba modules' enabling them:
texts.text: The SPRM processes are grouped into three distinct stages, enabled either through an 'SAP Ariba module'  or  managed  offline.  Below  is  an  illustration  of  these  stages  and  respective  'SAP  Ariba modules' enabling them:

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: Figure 2.5.2 SPRM processes and 'SAP Ariba' stages
texts.text: Figure 2.5.2 SPRM processes and 'SAP Ariba' stages

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Segment Suppliers is  enabled through 'SAP Ariba Knowledge Projects (Supplier Segmentation)'. A 'Knowledge Projects (Supplier Segmentation)' is created at the GPO level to categorize all Suppliers catering to Common Categories and at each Entity level to categorize all Suppliers catering to EntitySpecific Categories. An SRM Specialist is  assigned as  the  "Project  Owner" for 'Knowledge Projects (Supplier Segmentation)'.
texts.text: Segment Suppliers is  enabled through 'SAP Ariba Knowledge Projects (Supplier Segmentation)'. A 'Knowledge Projects (Supplier Segmentation)' is created at the GPO level to categorize all Suppliers catering to Common Categories and at each Entity level to categorize all Suppliers catering to EntitySpecific Categories. An SRM Specialist is  assigned as  the  "Project  Owner" for 'Knowledge Projects (Supplier Segmentation)'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Manage  Supplier  Relationships enables  development  of  collaborative  relationships  with  selected Suppliers .  It  is  executed at the GPO level for Suppliers catering to Common Categories and at each Entity level for Suppliers catering to Entity-Specific Categories. This stage is executed entirely outside 'SAP Ariba'. An SRM Specialist may be assigned as the single point of contact (SPOC) to execute and manage process for shortlisted Suppliers .
texts.text: Manage  Supplier  Relationships enables  development  of  collaborative  relationships  with  selected Suppliers .  It  is  executed at the GPO level for Suppliers catering to Common Categories and at each Entity level for Suppliers catering to Entity-Specific Categories. This stage is executed entirely outside 'SAP Ariba'. An SRM Specialist may be assigned as the single point of contact (SPOC) to execute and manage process for shortlisted Suppliers .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Manage Supplier Performance enables evaluation, monitoring, and management of the Supplier performance against  open  contracts.  It  is  enabled  through  the  'SAP  Ariba  Supplier  Performance Management (SPM) Module'. For a Common Category contract, the 'SPM project' is created and managed by the GPO, and for an Entity-Specific Category contract, the 'SPM project' is created and managed by the respective Entity. The Contracting Specialist/Lead assigned as the 'Project Owner' of the original 'Contract Workspace' should be assigned the 'Project Owner' of the associated 'SPM project'.
texts.text: The Manage Supplier Performance enables evaluation, monitoring, and management of the Supplier performance against  open  contracts.  It  is  enabled  through  the  'SAP  Ariba  Supplier  Performance Management (SPM) Module'. For a Common Category contract, the 'SPM project' is created and managed by the GPO, and for an Entity-Specific Category contract, the 'SPM project' is created and managed by the respective Entity. The Contracting Specialist/Lead assigned as the 'Project Owner' of the original 'Contract Workspace' should be assigned the 'Project Owner' of the associated 'SPM project'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Segment  Suppliers  process  is  executed  periodically,  preferably  once  a  year.  The  process  of segmenting Suppliers into  pre-defined  groups  (Strategic,  Critical,  Transactional,  and  Operational) enables the procurement to optimize and prioritize its efforts and focus on developing long-term relationships with the right Suppliers.
texts.text: Segment  Suppliers  process  is  executed  periodically,  preferably  once  a  year.  The  process  of segmenting Suppliers into  pre-defined  groups  (Strategic,  Critical,  Transactional,  and  Operational) enables the procurement to optimize and prioritize its efforts and focus on developing long-term relationships with the right Suppliers.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: While segmenting Suppliers, it is crucial to consider the contracted spend with each  Supplier  for  the  same  period  to  maintain  a  fair  comparison.  Suppliers  that  do  not  have contracted spend for the period of review may not be considered for Segment Suppliers process.
texts.text: Important Note: While segmenting Suppliers, it is crucial to consider the contracted spend with each  Supplier  for  the  same  period  to  maintain  a  fair  comparison.  Suppliers  that  do  not  have contracted spend for the period of review may not be considered for Segment Suppliers process.

texts.text: The  assigned SRM  Specialist creates  the  'Knowledge  Project  (Supplier  Segmentation)'  by selecting  the  "Knowledge  Projects'  from  'SAP  Ariba  Dashboard',  completing  the  'Overview Form', and selecting the 'Supplier Segmentation Template'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The assigned SRM Specialist may  link  the  'Knowledge  Project  (Supplier  Segmentation)'  to a previously executed 'Knowledge Project (Supplier Segmentation)' by selecting the 'Predecessor Project' field in the 'Overview Form'. This helps in indicating the relationship between projects in 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: The assigned SRM Specialist may  link  the  'Knowledge  Project  (Supplier  Segmentation)'  to a previously executed 'Knowledge Project (Supplier Segmentation)' by selecting the 'Predecessor Project' field in the 'Overview Form'. This helps in indicating the relationship between projects in 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text

texts.text: In case, the 'Knowledge Project (Supplier Segmentation)' created is identical (or similar) to a previously executed 'Knowledge Project (Supplier Segmentation)', the assigned SRM Specialist may use the 'Copy from Project' field to readily import (but not limited to) 'Overview Form' details, and if required, 'Project Groups' and documents from the previously executed project

texts.orig: The Supplier Segmentation depends on two parameters:
texts.text: The Supplier Segmentation depends on two parameters:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Business Impact of the Supplier implies how vital the Supplier is to business operations and future initiatives.
texts.text: Business Impact of the Supplier implies how vital the Supplier is to business operations and future initiatives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Supplier Risk /Complexity implies the dependence on the Supplier and ease of switching the Supplier , if required.
texts.text: Supplier Risk /Complexity implies the dependence on the Supplier and ease of switching the Supplier , if required.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The detailed criteria to score a Supplier on these parameters are provided in the 'Scoring Guidelines' tab of the 'Supplier Segmentation - Category Specific' document. A higher score implies higher business impact/complexity of the Supplier being evaluated. Scores on these two parameters serve as the criteria for segmenting the Supplier into one of the following segments:
texts.text: The detailed criteria to score a Supplier on these parameters are provided in the 'Scoring Guidelines' tab of the 'Supplier Segmentation - Category Specific' document. A higher score implies higher business impact/complexity of the Supplier being evaluated. Scores on these two parameters serve as the criteria for segmenting the Supplier into one of the following segments:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b1. Strategic  Supplier  Strategic  Suppliers  are  the Suppliers that  show  potential  of innovation and collaboration. These Suppliers usually have a proven track record and are some of the highest spend Suppliers .  An SRM Specialist is  assigned to each Strategic Supplier to monitor and ensure execution of the Supplier Segment Strategy elements specified in

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b4. Critical Supplier Critical Suppliers are critical to everyday operations, and any failure by such a Supplier usually has a significant impact. An SRM Specialist is assigned to each Critical  Supplier  to  monitor  and  ensure  execution  of  the  Supplier  Segment  Strategy elements specified in
texts.text: b4. Critical Supplier Critical Suppliers are critical to everyday operations, and any failure by such a Supplier usually has a significant impact. texts.text: b7. Operational  Supplier  Operational  Suppliers  have  contracted  commitments  that require operational tracking and delivery monitoring . Usually, s uch Suppliers are  not considered  for  development  and  collaboration  initiatives  or  Supplier  Risk  Profiling process.

texts.orig: The 'Supplier Segmentation - Category Specific' document is filled for each category by the respective Category Manager. The Category Manager identifies and scores each Supplier, on the  above-explained  parameters,  within  the  category  in  the  'Data  Input'  tab  of  the document.
texts.text: The 'Supplier Segmentation - Category Specific' document is filled for each category by the respective Category Manager. The Category Manager identifies and scores each Supplier, on the  above-explained  parameters,  within  the  category  in  the  'Data  Input'  tab  of  the document.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Category Manager may share this document with the relevant Contract Administrators/End-Users to  collate  required  inputs.  The  collation  of  these  inputs  is

texts.text: Important  Note:  While  collating  data  for  their  category,  the  Category  Manager  /  Contract Administrator / End-User are advised to ensure that the entire contracted spend is accounted for in the 'Data Inputs' tab.

The 'Project  Owner'  can  download  the  'Supplier  Segmentation  Consolidated'  document  from 'Documents' tab.
texts.text: The 'Project  Owner'  downloads  and  collates  the  received  survey  responses  in  the  'Supplier Segmentation - Consolidated' document and modifies the 'Final Supplier Segment' tab. The 'Project  Owner'  can  download  the  'Supplier  Segmentation  Consolidated'  document  from 'Documents' tab.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This  'Supplier  Segmentation  -  Consolidated'  document  when  completed  forms  the  'Supplier Segmentation Report'. Only one 'Supplier Segmentation Report' and should include all Suppliers .
texts.text: This  'Supplier  Segmentation  -  Consolidated'  document  when  completed  forms  the  'Supplier Segmentation Report'. Only one 'Supplier Segmentation Report' and should include all Suppliers .

texts.text: The key outcome of the 'Supplier Segmentation Report' is the Supplier Segmentation Matrix (illustrated in Figure 2.5.4) which provides a relative position of a Supplier .

texts.orig: 6) Obtain approval of the 'Supplier Segmentation Report'
texts.text: 6) Obtain approval of the 'Supplier Segmentation Report'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Project Owner' uploads the completed 'Supplier Segmentation Report' in 'Documents' tab for approval by the 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA .
texts.text: 'Project Owner' uploads the completed 'Supplier Segmentation Report' in 'Documents' tab for approval by the 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If 'Approvers' reject the 'Supplier Segmentation Report', they must provide a valid justification to  the  'Project  Owner'.  If  'Approvers'  recommend  changes  to  the  'Supplier  Segmentation Report', the 'Project Owner' makes the recommended modifications and uploads the updated version of the 'Supplier Segmentation Report' in the 'Knowledge Project (Supplier Segmentation)' for approval.
texts.text: If 'Approvers' reject the 'Supplier Segmentation Report', they must provide a valid justification to  the  'Project  Owner'.  If  'Approvers'  recommend  changes  to  the  'Supplier  Segmentation Report', the 'Project Owner' makes the recommended modifications and uploads the updated version of the 'Supplier Segmentation Report' in the 'Knowledge Project (Supplier Segmentation)' for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  the  'Approvers'  approve  the  'Supplier  Segmentation  Report',  the  respective  segment strategies are executed across Suppliers .
texts.text: If  the  'Approvers'  approve  the  'Supplier  Segmentation  Report',  the  respective  segment strategies are executed across Suppliers .

texts.orig: The assigned SRM Specialist may consider the following points while completing the 'Supplier Development and Collaboration Plan' document:
texts.text: The assigned SRM Specialist may consider the following points while completing the 'Supplier Development and Collaboration Plan' document:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The  development  and  collaboration  opportunities  are  derived  from  the  'Procurement Strategy' and/or the 'Category Strategy' documents.
texts.text: The  development  and  collaboration  opportunities  are  derived  from  the  'Procurement Strategy' and/or the 'Category Strategy' documents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Supplier development and collaboration enablers (provided in the 'Supplier Development and  Collaboration  Plan'  document)  can  be  utilized  to  specify  existing  opportunities  and identify additional opportunities.
texts.text: Supplier development and collaboration enablers (provided in the 'Supplier Development and  Collaboration  Plan'  document)  can  be  utilized  to  specify  existing  opportunities  and identify additional opportunities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. An  engagement  session  can  be  arranged  with the Supplier to identify additional opportunities as well as finalize and prioritize the identified opportunities.
texts.text: An  engagement  session  can  be  arranged  with the Supplier to identify additional opportunities as well as finalize and prioritize the identified opportunities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Based on the discussion, the assigned SRM Specialist completes the 'Progress Tracker' tab in the 'Supplier Development and Collaboration Plan' document and shares it with respective stakeholders (including the Supplier ) for execution.
texts.text: Based on the discussion, the assigned SRM Specialist completes the 'Progress Tracker' tab in the 'Supplier Development and Collaboration Plan' document and shares it with respective stakeholders (including the Supplier ) for execution.

The  assigned SRM Specialist periodically collates  inputs  from  the  stakeholders  executing  the  plan,  to  monitor  and  ensure  closure  of opportunities.

texts.orig: Supplier performance is evaluated and monitored regularly against all open contracts. Below is an illustration of how the 'SPM Project' is linked to the 'Contract Workspace' and how a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' can be created in the 'SPM module'
texts.text: Supplier performance is evaluated and monitored regularly against all open contracts. Below is an illustration of how the 'SPM Project' is linked to the 'Contract Workspace' and how a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' can be created in the 'SPM module'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As  illustrated  above,  in  the  'SAP  Ariba  Sourcing  module',  two  'Sourcing  Projects'  are  executed where Supplier A wins selected line items. In the 'SAP Ariba CLM module', a 'Contract Workspace' is created against each 'Sourcing Project' with the 'Main Contract Document' and 'CLID' specific to Supplier A.
texts.text: As  illustrated  above,  in  the  'SAP  Ariba  Sourcing  module',  two  'Sourcing  Projects'  are  executed where Supplier A wins selected line items. In the 'SAP Ariba CLM module', a 'Contract Workspace' is created against each 'Sourcing Project' with the 'Main Contract Document' and 'CLID' specific to Supplier A.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An  'SPM  Project'  is  created  against  a  'Contract  Workspace',  enabling  the  evaluation  and management of Supplier performance against the associated contract. (e.g., in above illustration an 'SPM Project' is created against each 'Contract Workspaces').
texts.text: An  'SPM  Project'  is  created  against  a  'Contract  Workspace',  enabling  the  evaluation  and management of Supplier performance against the associated contract. (e.g., in above illustration an 'SPM Project' is created against each 'Contract Workspaces').

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A key outcome of the 'SPM Project' is a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard', which summarizes how the Supplier is  performing  against  the  KPIs  and  goals  established  in  the  contract.  (e.g.,  in  above illustration, a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' is created against each 'SPM Project')
texts.text: A key outcome of the 'SPM Project' is a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard', which summarizes how the Supplier is  performing  against  the  KPIs  and  goals  established  in  the  contract.  (e.g.,  in  above illustration, a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' is created against each 'SPM Project')

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Supplier  Performance  Scorecards'  from  all  associated  'SPM  Projects'  for  the Supplier are consolidated, by 'SAP Ariba', to provide an overall 'Supplier Performance Scorecard'. (e.g., in above illustration, 'Supplier Performance Scorecards' against the two 'SPM Projects' merge into an overall 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' for Supplier A )
texts.text: 'Supplier  Performance  Scorecards'  from  all  associated  'SPM  Projects'  for  the Supplier are consolidated, by 'SAP Ariba', to provide an overall 'Supplier Performance Scorecard'. (e.g., in above illustration, 'Supplier Performance Scorecards' against the two 'SPM Projects' merge into an overall 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' for Supplier A )

texts.orig: The  assigned Contracting  Specialist/Lead creates  an  'SPM  Project'  either  from  within  a 'Contract Workspace' or by selecting the 'Supplier Performance Management Project' from 'SAP Ariba Dashboard' and completing the 'Overview Form'.
texts.text: The  assigned Contracting  Specialist/Lead creates  an  'SPM  Project'  either  from  within  a 'Contract Workspace' or by selecting the 'Supplier Performance Management Project' from 'SAP Ariba Dashboard' and completing the 'Overview Form'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead may link the 'SPM Project' to a previously executed 'SPM  Project'  or  'Contract  Workspace'  by  selecting  the  'Predecessor  Project'  field  in  the 'Overview Form'. This helps in indicating the relationship between projects in 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: The assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead may link the 'SPM Project' to a previously executed 'SPM  Project'  or  'Contract  Workspace'  by  selecting  the  'Predecessor  Project'  field  in  the 'Overview Form'. This helps in indicating the relationship between projects in 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case, the 'SPM Project' created is identical (or similar) to a previously executed 'Contract Workspace', the assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead may use the 'Copy from Project' field to readily import (but not limited to) 'Overview Form' details, and if required, 'Project Groups' and documents from the previously executed project into the current project. This imported information is modifiable in the current 'SPM Project'.
texts.text: In case, the 'SPM Project' created is identical (or similar) to a previously executed 'Contract Workspace', the assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead may use the 'Copy from Project' field to readily import (but not limited to) 'Overview Form' details, and if required, 'Project Groups' and documents from the previously executed project into the current project. This imported information is modifiable in the current 'SPM Project'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'SPM Project' gets activated when the 'Overview Form' is completed and submitted by the assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead .  This Contracting Specialist/Lead becomes the 'Project Owner' of the project.
texts.text: The 'SPM Project' gets activated when the 'Overview Form' is completed and submitted by the assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead .  This Contracting Specialist/Lead becomes the 'Project Owner' of the project.

texts.orig: The KPIs, criteria within each KPI, and frequency of performance evaluations are communicated to  the Supplier outside  'SAP  Ariba'.  The  'Project  Owner'  marks  the  task 'Completed'  after communicating with the Supplier .
texts.text: The KPIs, criteria within each KPI, and frequency of performance evaluations are communicated to  the Supplier outside  'SAP  Ariba'.  The  'Project  Owner'  marks  the  task 'Completed'  after communicating with the Supplier .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  'Supplier  Performance  Input  Collection  Survey'  gets  automatically  published  as  per  the recurrence  set  by  the  'Project  Owner'  while  completing  the  'Overview  Form'.  The  'Project Owner' is intimated about the upcoming survey to make any required changes to the survey rules, content, and participants, for the upcoming evaluation cycle.
texts.text: The  'Supplier  Performance  Input  Collection  Survey'  gets  automatically  published  as  per  the recurrence  set  by  the  'Project  Owner'  while  completing  the  'Overview  Form'.  The  'Project Owner' is intimated about the upcoming survey to make any required changes to the survey rules, content, and participants, for the upcoming evaluation cycle.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  survey  participants  must  provide  their  responses  against  each  question  provided  in  the survey within 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: The  survey  participants  must  provide  their  responses  against  each  question  provided  in  the survey within 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'SAP  Ariba'  generates  the  'Supplier  Performance  Scorecard'  based  on  the  survey  responses received, automatically. The 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' provides Supplier scores against each KPI and indicates the areas of improvement (KPIs where target grade is not met).
texts.text: 'SAP  Ariba'  generates  the  'Supplier  Performance  Scorecard'  based  on  the  survey  responses received, automatically. The 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' provides Supplier scores against each KPI and indicates the areas of improvement (KPIs where target grade is not met).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' reviews and publishes the 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' for the other 'Project Groups' members to view in 'SAP Ariba' and shares it with the Supplier outside 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' reviews and publishes the 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' for the other 'Project Groups' members to view in 'SAP Ariba' and shares it with the Supplier outside 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If the Supplier performs satisfactorily on all KPIs (met the target grade), the evaluation cycle may be considered closed, and the 'Project Owner' repeats the entire process for the next evaluation cycle.
texts.text: If the Supplier performs satisfactorily on all KPIs (met the target grade), the evaluation cycle may be considered closed, and the 'Project Owner' repeats the entire process for the next evaluation cycle.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  the Supplier fails  to  perform  satisfactorily  against  any  of  the  KPIs,  the  'Project  Owner' completes the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' document to rectify the performance Below is the structure of the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' document:
texts.text: If  the Supplier fails  to  perform  satisfactorily  against  any  of  the  KPIs,  the  'Project  Owner' completes the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' document to rectify the performance Below is the structure of the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' document:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Table 2.5.6 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' document structure
texts.text: Table 2.5.6 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' document structure

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' downloads the 'SPM Plan' document from the 'Documents' tab of the 'SPM Project' and completes the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' tab. The 'Project Owner' may consider the following points while completing the 'SPM Plan' tab:
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' downloads the 'SPM Plan' document from the 'Documents' tab of the 'SPM Project' and completes the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' tab. The 'Project Owner' may consider the following points while completing the 'SPM Plan' tab:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. For  each  KPI  (where Supplier performance  is  lacking),  identify  the  root  cause,  potential impact,  corrective  actions,  owner  of  the  corrective  action,  completion  date  and  ease  of implementation.
texts.text: For  each  KPI  (where Supplier performance  is  lacking),  identify  the  root  cause,  potential impact,  corrective  actions,  owner  of  the  corrective  action,  completion  date  and  ease  of implementation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Each row should refer to a unique 'Corrective action.'
texts.text: Each row should refer to a unique 'Corrective action.'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  'Project  Owner'  reviews  the  completed  'SPM  Plan',  with  the Supplier, to  finalize  and prioritize the corrective actions to be executed. Based on this review, the corrective actions may be modified, or additional actions may be identified. Relevant changes must be made to the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' tab before uploading it in the 'SPM Project' for review and approval.
texts.text: The  'Project  Owner'  reviews  the  completed  'SPM  Plan',  with  the Supplier, to  finalize  and prioritize the corrective actions to be executed. Based on this review, the corrective actions may be modified, or additional actions may be identified. Relevant changes must be made to the 'Supplier Performance Management Plan' tab before uploading it in the 'SPM Project' for review and approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Only the 'SPM Plan' tab of the document is uploaded for review and approval. The 'Progress Report' tab is not uploaded at this point.
texts.text: Only the 'SPM Plan' tab of the document is uploaded for review and approval. The 'Progress Report' tab is not uploaded at this point.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  'SPM  Plan'  is  reviewed  and  approved  by  the  'Approvers'  designated as  per  the  PDoA . 'Approvers'  may  consider following points while reviewing the 'Supplier  Performance Management Plan':
texts.text: The  'SPM  Plan'  is  reviewed  and  approved  by  the  'Approvers'  designated as  per  the  PDoA . 'Approvers'  may  consider following points while reviewing the 'Supplier  Performance Management Plan':

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Each row of the 'SPM Plan' tab should refer to a unique corrective action.
texts.text: Each row of the 'SPM Plan' tab should refer to a unique corrective action.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The  root  cause  analysis  and  identified  impacts  should  be  accurate  and  based  on  logical, objective criteria.
texts.text: The  root  cause  analysis  and  identified  impacts  should  be  accurate  and  based  on  logical, objective criteria.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The corrective actions must address the root cause and mitigate the impact.
texts.text: The corrective actions must address the root cause and mitigate the impact.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The target date for the corrective actions must be realistic.
texts.text: The target date for the corrective actions must be realistic.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. The  corrective  actions  must  be  aligned  to  the  overall  'Category  Strategy',  'Procurement Strategy', and the Supplier Segment Strategy.
texts.text: The  corrective  actions  must  be  aligned  to  the  overall  'Category  Strategy',  'Procurement Strategy', and the Supplier Segment Strategy.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Approvers' may suggest modifications to the plan, which the 'Project Owner' makes and re-submits the plan for approval.
texts.text: The 'Approvers' may suggest modifications to the plan, which the 'Project Owner' makes and re-submits the plan for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' shares the approved 'SPM Plan' with relevant stakeholders for execution and monitoring outside 'SAP Ariba'.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' shares the approved 'SPM Plan' with relevant stakeholders for execution and monitoring outside 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The progress against the approved 'SPM Plan' is monitored regularly to ensure better Supplier performance in the  next  evaluation cycle.  This monitoring  is  managed  entirely  outside  'SAP Ariba' and follows the below steps:
texts.text: The progress against the approved 'SPM Plan' is monitored regularly to ensure better Supplier performance in the  next  evaluation cycle.  This monitoring  is  managed  entirely  outside  'SAP Ariba' and follows the below steps:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Step 1 - The 'Project Owner' fills in the 'Progress Report' tab of the 'SPM Plan' (downloaded in the previous process) with approved high priority corrective actions.
texts.text: Step 1 - The 'Project Owner' fills in the 'Progress Report' tab of the 'SPM Plan' (downloaded in the previous process) with approved high priority corrective actions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Step 2 - The 'Project Owner' sends this 'Progress Report' tab to individuals executing the 'SPM Plan' to track the progress made against each corrective action.
texts.text: Step 2 - The 'Project Owner' sends this 'Progress Report' tab to individuals executing the 'SPM Plan' to track the progress made against each corrective action.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Step 3 -  The  'Project Owner' monitors the progress made against each corrective action through multiple rounds of inputs, if required.
texts.text: Step 3 -  The  'Project Owner' monitors the progress made against each corrective action through multiple rounds of inputs, if required.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' may close the 'SPM Plan' by uploading the updated 'Progress Report' tab in the 'Documents' tab and marking the 'Monitor and Close Plan' task 'Complete'.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' may close the 'SPM Plan' by uploading the updated 'Progress Report' tab in the 'Documents' tab and marking the 'Monitor and Close Plan' task 'Complete'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Project Owner' marks the 'SPM Project' 'Completed', through the 'Overview' tab, after the associated 'Contract Workspace' is 'Closed' or 'Expired'.
texts.text: The 'Project Owner' marks the 'SPM Project' 'Completed', through the 'Overview' tab, after the associated 'Contract Workspace' is 'Closed' or 'Expired'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Requisition  to  Pay  (R2P)  process  group  consists  of  procedures  for  creation  and  approval  of Purchase Requisitions (PR), Purchase Orders (PO) and Goods/Services/Projects Receipts. It details the procedures for conducting Emergency, Petty Cash, and P-Card purchases and receiving goods/services/projects.
texts.text: The  Requisition  to  Pay  (R2P)  process  group  consists  of  procedures  for  creation  and  approval  of Purchase Requisitions (PR), Purchase Orders (PO) and Goods/Services/Projects Receipts. It details the procedures for conducting Emergency, Petty Cash, and P-Card purchases and receiving goods/services/projects.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the R2P processes.
texts.text: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the R2P processes.

texts.text: Below is an illustration of the R2P Level 3 processes:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The purpose of this process is to create and obtain approvals for the Purchase Requisition (PR). The End User creates the PR to request goods/services/projects and obtain necessary approvals for the purchase.
texts.text: The purpose of this process is to create and obtain approvals for the Purchase Requisition (PR). The End User creates the PR to request goods/services/projects and obtain necessary approvals for the purchase.

texts.label: section_header

texts.text: ii. (B) Process Flow and Key Tasks

texts.text: Figure 2.6.2 Process Flow and Key Tasks - Create and Approve PR

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The End-User creates a PR to request goods/services/projects considering (but not limited to):
texts.text: The End-User creates a PR to request goods/services/projects considering (but not limited to):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Technical specifications, scope, and time plan which may be required in the PR.
texts.text: Technical specifications, scope, and time plan which may be required in the PR.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Budget estimated and reserved for the PR
texts.text: Budget estimated and reserved for the PR

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. In case the requirements in the PR exceed the allocated budget, the End-User either arranges for additional budget, in consultation with the Budget Owner , or modifies the requirements in the PR to fit the allocated budget.
texts.text: In case the requirements in the PR exceed the allocated budget, the End-User either arranges for additional budget, in consultation with the Budget Owner , or modifies the requirements in the PR to fit the allocated budget.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: A procurement requirement is not to be split into multiple PRs  to bypass approval authorities.
texts.text: Important Note: A procurement requirement is not to be split into multiple PRs  to bypass approval authorities.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: PR is reviewed and approved by approvers designated as per the PDoA .  These approvers are from the Business , the Finance , and the Procurement .
texts.text: PR is reviewed and approved by approvers designated as per the PDoA .  These approvers are from the Business , the Finance , and the Procurement .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Procurement verifies,  if  the  PR  requirements  can  be  met  by  existing  stock/inventory.  If available, the requested goods are issued from the stock/inventory and the PR is cancelled by the End-User . If not available, the PR is reviewed for other details.
texts.text: The Procurement verifies,  if  the  PR  requirements  can  be  met  by  existing  stock/inventory.  If available, the requested goods are issued from the stock/inventory and the PR is cancelled by the End-User . If not available, the PR is reviewed for other details.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If the approvers suggest modifications to the PR, the End-User makes the recommended changes and re-submits the updated PR for approval.
texts.text: If the approvers suggest modifications to the PR, the End-User makes the recommended changes and re-submits the updated PR for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An approved PR leads directly to PO unless the source of supply or conditions of the purchase must first be determined, in which case the 'Sourcing Request' is created by the Procurement for execution of Sourcing.
texts.text: An approved PR leads directly to PO unless the source of supply or conditions of the purchase must first be determined, in which case the 'Sourcing Request' is created by the Procurement for execution of Sourcing.
