texts.orig: Multiple Purchase Requisitions (PR) may either be consolidated into aggregate PO or single PR may require multiple POs for the following reasons:
texts.text: Multiple Purchase Requisitions (PR) may either be consolidated into aggregate PO or single PR may require multiple POs for the following reasons:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Same/Different  Suppliers -  Goods/services/projects  requested  in  the  PR  are  procured through one or multiple Suppliers.
texts.text: Same/Different  Suppliers -  Goods/services/projects  requested  in  the  PR  are  procured through one or multiple Suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Same/Different Ship to Address -  Goods/services/projects requested in the PR are to be delivered across one or more locations.
texts.text: Same/Different Ship to Address -  Goods/services/projects requested in the PR are to be delivered across one or more locations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Catalogue vs. Non-Catalogue - Goods/services/projects requested in the PR may be partially fulfilled through an existing contract.
texts.text: Catalogue vs. Non-Catalogue - Goods/services/projects requested in the PR may be partially fulfilled through an existing contract.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Important Note: An approved PR is not to be split into multiple POs to bypass approval authorities.
texts.text: Important Note: An approved PR is not to be split into multiple POs to bypass approval authorities.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A PR may be converted into a PO directly, through an existing contract, or through sourcing and contracting processes. PO is created by the Procurement .
texts.text: A PR may be converted into a PO directly, through an existing contract, or through sourcing and contracting processes. PO is created by the Procurement .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: Approved PR is verified by the Procurement against existing contracts to identify if the requirement can be fulfilled without entering into new obligations.
texts.text: Important Note: Approved PR is verified by the Procurement against existing contracts to identify if the requirement can be fulfilled without entering into new obligations.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A Purchase Order (PO) includes details defining what the Supplier needs to fulfil the order. The PO serves as an electronic trace defining the purchase. The details relevant for the PO include (but not limited to):
texts.text: A Purchase Order (PO) includes details defining what the Supplier needs to fulfil the order. The PO serves as an electronic trace defining the purchase. The details relevant for the PO include (but not limited to):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Descriptions, quantities, prices, and discounts on goods/services/projects in the order
texts.text: Descriptions, quantities, prices, and discounts on goods/services/projects in the order

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Payment terms along with shipment/delivery dates
texts.text: Payment terms along with shipment/delivery dates

texts.label: text
texts.orig: PO is reviewed and approved by approvers designated as per the PDoA . If the approvers suggest modifications to the PO, the Procurement makes the recommended changes and re-submits the updated PO for approval. Approved PO is sent to the Supplier for delivery of goods/services/projects.
texts.text: PO is reviewed and approved by approvers designated as per the PDoA . If the approvers suggest modifications to the PO, the Procurement makes the recommended changes and re-submits the updated PO for approval. Approved PO is sent to the Supplier for delivery of goods/services/projects.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier confirms  the  receipt  of  the  PO  and  specifies  whether  it  can  provide  the  entire quantities specified in the PO or not, as a part of this process.
texts.text: The Supplier confirms  the  receipt  of  the  PO  and  specifies  whether  it  can  provide  the  entire quantities specified in the PO or not, as a part of this process.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In cases where a Supplier can only provide partial quantities, the Procurement can edit the PO for the quantities confirmed by the Supplier . The modified PO needs to go through the approval process explained above.
texts.text: In cases where a Supplier can only provide partial quantities, the Procurement can edit the PO for the quantities confirmed by the Supplier . The modified PO needs to go through the approval process explained above.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Receive goods/services/projects and match against PO
texts.text: 1) Receive goods/services/projects and match against PO

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The goods received by the End-User or the store/warehouse are reviewed to ensure that the quantity delivered and specifications match with the PO and the delivery documents.
texts.text: The goods received by the End-User or the store/warehouse are reviewed to ensure that the quantity delivered and specifications match with the PO and the delivery documents.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Based on the review, one of the following approaches may be taken:
texts.text: Based on the review, one of the following approaches may be taken:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delivery of goods may be rejected if the quantity or the specifications do not match with that provided in the PO. In such cases, the discrepancy is communicated to the Procurement and the Supplier. Depending  on  the  reason  for  rejection,  the Supplier either  replaces  the defective/damaged goods or delivers the missing goods.
texts.text: Delivery of goods may be rejected if the quantity or the specifications do not match with that provided in the PO. In such cases, the discrepancy is communicated to the Procurement and the Supplier. Depending  on  the  reason  for  rejection,  the Supplier either  replaces  the defective/damaged goods or delivers the missing goods.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case of services/projects, the Supplier is communicated of the deficiency of service against the PO (mapped against milestones, variance from the KPI's/SLA, timelines etc.).
texts.text: In case of services/projects, the Supplier is communicated of the deficiency of service against the PO (mapped against milestones, variance from the KPI's/SLA, timelines etc.).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delivery of goods/services/projects can be rejected completely or partially (e.g., % of goods delivered  are  not  as  per  the  specification  in  the  PO).  In  case  of  partial  rejection,  partial Goods/Services/Projects Receipt is created against the PO.
texts.text: Delivery of goods/services/projects can be rejected completely or partially (e.g., % of goods delivered  are  not  as  per  the  specification  in  the  PO).  In  case  of  partial  rejection,  partial Goods/Services/Projects Receipt is created against the PO.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If required, the Procurement may also fulfil the pending requirement through an alternate Supplier .
texts.text: If required, the Procurement may also fulfil the pending requirement through an alternate Supplier .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delivery of goods is accepted if the quantity and specifications of goods received match with that  provided  in  the  PO.  In  case  of  services/projects,  the End-User provide  inputs  on service/projects delivery with milestones, KPI's/SLA, timelines etc. which is used to provide delivery acceptance.
texts.text: Delivery of goods is accepted if the quantity and specifications of goods received match with that  provided  in  the  PO.  In  case  of  services/projects,  the End-User provide  inputs  on service/projects delivery with milestones, KPI's/SLA, timelines etc. which is used to provide delivery acceptance.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: End-User creates Goods/Service/Projects Receipt reflecting the goods/services/projects accepted upon delivery or post inspection. In case of goods/services/projects with high value , Entity may choose to form a committee to conduct the inspection.
texts.text: End-User creates Goods/Service/Projects Receipt reflecting the goods/services/projects accepted upon delivery or post inspection. In case of goods/services/projects with high value , Entity may choose to form a committee to conduct the inspection.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Goods/Service/Projects Receipt is reviewed by the approvers designated as per the PDoA . In case the approvers suggest modifications to the Goods/Service/Projects Receipt, the End-User makes necessary modifications and re-submits it for approval.
texts.text: The Goods/Service/Projects Receipt is reviewed by the approvers designated as per the PDoA . In case the approvers suggest modifications to the Goods/Service/Projects Receipt, the End-User makes necessary modifications and re-submits it for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Goods/Service/Projects  Receipt  and  PO  are  used  as  reference  documents  for  invoice reconciliation process and authorizing payment to the Supplier .
texts.text: The  Goods/Service/Projects  Receipt  and  PO  are  used  as  reference  documents  for  invoice reconciliation process and authorizing payment to the Supplier .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The purpose of this process is to enable  expedited purchases in case of operational or personal emergencies  as  defined in  the  Procurement  Standards .  The Procurement must  ensure  that emergency purchase is not used as an excuse for failing to plan.
texts.text: The purpose of this process is to enable  expedited purchases in case of operational or personal emergencies  as  defined in  the  Procurement  Standards .  The Procurement must  ensure  that emergency purchase is not used as an excuse for failing to plan.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important  Note:  This  process  is  applicable  to  emergency  purchase  above  the  spend  threshold specified for P-Card or Petty Cash purchases in the PDoA. Emergency purchases below this spend threshold can be managed through P-Card or Petty Cash, as applicable.
texts.text: Important  Note:  This  process  is  applicable  to  emergency  purchase  above  the  spend  threshold specified for P-Card or Petty Cash purchases in the PDoA. Emergency purchases below this spend threshold can be managed through P-Card or Petty Cash, as applicable.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The End-User creates and submits the PR and justification for Emergency purchase for approvals by approvers designated as per the PDoA .
texts.text: The End-User creates and submits the PR and justification for Emergency purchase for approvals by approvers designated as per the PDoA .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If approvers reject the justification for the emergency purchase, the requested goods/services/projects must be procured through regular channels. If approvers recommend modifications to the justification, the End-User makes the recommended modifications and resubmits PR and justification for the emergency purchase for approval.
texts.text: If approvers reject the justification for the emergency purchase, the requested goods/services/projects must be procured through regular channels. If approvers recommend modifications to the justification, the End-User makes the recommended modifications and resubmits PR and justification for the emergency purchase for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Approved PR is used by the Procurement to verify if the requirements can be met by existing stock/inventory.  If  available,  the  requested  goods  are  issued  from  the  stock/inventory.  If required goods are not available, the Procurement creates the PO and submits it for approvals by approvers designated as per the PDoA .
texts.text: Approved PR is used by the Procurement to verify if the requirements can be met by existing stock/inventory.  If  available,  the  requested  goods  are  issued  from  the  stock/inventory.  If required goods are not available, the Procurement creates the PO and submits it for approvals by approvers designated as per the PDoA .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If approvers recommend modifications to the PO, the Procurement makes the recommended modifications and re-submits it for approval.
texts.text: If approvers recommend modifications to the PO, the Procurement makes the recommended modifications and re-submits it for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Procurement engages  with  the Supplier and  procures  the  required  goods/services/projects. Supplier provides an invoice of the purchase to the End-User .
texts.text: Procurement engages  with  the Supplier and  procures  the  required  goods/services/projects. Supplier provides an invoice of the purchase to the End-User .

Otherwise, the End-user may directly engage with the Supplier and procure required goods/services/projects, without an approved PR or PO. The Supplier provides an invoice of the purchase to the End-User .
texts.text: The End-User verifies if the requirement can be fulfilled by existing stock/inventory. If available, the requested goods are issued from the stock/inventory. The Supplier provides an invoice of the purchase to the End-User .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Risk  and  Regulation  (R&R)  process  group  consists  of  procedures  for  the  management  of procurement risks and regulatory changes.
texts.text: The  Risk  and  Regulation  (R&R)  process  group  consists  of  procedures  for  the  management  of procurement risks and regulatory changes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the R&R processes.
texts.text: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the R&R processes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Procurement risk  is  defined  as  a  potential  for  failure  of  any  of  the  procurement  processes. Procurement risks may be associated with Supplier , supply chain, and procurement organization as illustrated below:
texts.text: Procurement risk  is  defined  as  a  potential  for  failure  of  any  of  the  procurement  processes. Procurement risks may be associated with Supplier , supply chain, and procurement organization as illustrated below:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Risks emerging from Suppliers ' end and are specific to Supplier (e.g., bankruptcies, location change, price increase, quality/delivery failure, mergers and acquisitions etc.)
texts.text: Risks emerging from Suppliers ' end and are specific to Supplier (e.g., bankruptcies, location change, price increase, quality/delivery failure, mergers and acquisitions etc.)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Risks  emerging  from  unexpected  external  market  events  (e.g., environmental  disasters  causing  supply  chain  disruption,  price  and supply volatility, supply shock, etc.)
texts.text: Risks  emerging  from  unexpected  external  market  events  (e.g., environmental  disasters  causing  supply  chain  disruption,  price  and supply volatility, supply shock, etc.)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Risks  emerging  from  internal  processes/organization  (e.g.,  incorrect approach to market, insufficient procurement resources, absence of category expertise, etc.)
texts.text: Risks  emerging  from  internal  processes/organization  (e.g.,  incorrect approach to market, insufficient procurement resources, absence of category expertise, etc.)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All R&R procurement processes are enabled through the 'SAP Ariba Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)'. The R&R processes are clubbed into three distinct stages, each of which is enabled through a different risk profiling type (sub-template) within the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)' as illustrated below.
texts.text: All R&R procurement processes are enabled through the 'SAP Ariba Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)'. The R&R processes are clubbed into three distinct stages, each of which is enabled through a different risk profiling type (sub-template) within the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)' as illustrated below.

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: Figure 2.7.3 R&R processes and 'SAP Ariba' stages
texts.text: Figure 2.7.3 R&R processes and 'SAP Ariba' stages

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Profile  Supplier  Risk is  enabled  through  the  'Supplier  Risk  Profiling'  sub-template  within  the 'Knowledge Project  (Supply  Risk)'.  A  'Knowledge  Project  (Supply  Risk)  -  Supplier  Risk  Profiling'  is created at GPO level to profile Suppliers catering to Common Categories, and at each Entity level to profile Suppliers catering to Entity-Specific Categories. If a Supplier caters to Entity-Specific Categories and Common Categories, then the Supplier is profiled both at GPO and Entity level. An SRM Specialist is assigned as the "Project Owner" for the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Supplier Risk Profiling'.
texts.text: The Profile  Supplier  Risk is  enabled  through  the  'Supplier  Risk  Profiling'  sub-template  within  the 'Knowledge Project  (Supply  Risk)'.  A  'Knowledge  Project  (Supply  Risk)  -  Supplier  Risk  Profiling'  is created at GPO level to profile Suppliers catering to Common Categories, and at each Entity level to profile Suppliers catering to Entity-Specific Categories. If a Supplier caters to Entity-Specific Categories and Common Categories, then the Supplier is profiled both at GPO and Entity level. An SRM Specialist is assigned as the "Project Owner" for the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Supplier Risk Profiling'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Manage  Procurement  Risk is  enabled  through  the  'Mitigate  Risk'  sub-template  within  the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)'. A 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Mitigate Risk' is created at Entity/GPO level to manage respective procurement risks. An SRM Specialist is assigned as the "Project Owner" for the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Mitigate Risk'.
texts.text: The Manage  Procurement  Risk is  enabled  through  the  'Mitigate  Risk'  sub-template  within  the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)'. A 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Mitigate Risk' is created at Entity/GPO level to manage respective procurement risks. An SRM Specialist is assigned as the "Project Owner" for the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Mitigate Risk'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Manage  Regulation  Change is  enabled  via  the  'Regulation  Change'  sub-template  within  the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)'. A 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change' is only created at the GPO level. A Risk and Regulations Lead from the GPO is assigned as the "Project Owner" for the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change'.
texts.text: The Manage  Regulation  Change is  enabled  via  the  'Regulation  Change'  sub-template  within  the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk)'. A 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change' is only created at the GPO level. A Risk and Regulations Lead from the GPO is assigned as the "Project Owner" for the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change'.

texts.orig: The Supplier risk profile is determined by assessing following types of Supplier risks:
texts.text: The Supplier risk profile is determined by assessing following types of Supplier risks:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The detailed evaluation criteria for these risks is provided in the 'Risk Profiling Criteria' tab of the 'Supplier Risk Profiling' document. A higher score implies higher associated risk.
texts.text: The detailed evaluation criteria for these risks is provided in the 'Risk Profiling Criteria' tab of the 'Supplier Risk Profiling' document. A higher score implies higher associated risk.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suppliers are evaluated on above mentioned risk types on a five-point scale (0 - No risk, 1 - Low Risk, 2- Medium risk, 3 - High risk, and 4 - Significant risk). Suppliers with a score of 3 (or above) on any of the risk types are considered as high-risk Suppliers .
texts.text: Suppliers are evaluated on above mentioned risk types on a five-point scale (0 - No risk, 1 - Low Risk, 2- Medium risk, 3 - High risk, and 4 - Significant risk). Suppliers with a score of 3 (or above) on any of the risk types are considered as high-risk Suppliers .

texts.text: The survey participants fill this tab with details such as risk title, description, and root cause for all existing/potential procurement risks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Details from the 'Risk Identification' tab are auto imported into the 'Risk Assessment' tab. The survey participants assess the severity and likelihood of each risk in this tab. Detailed criteria  for  these  parameters  are  provided  in  the  'Risk  Assessment  Criteria'  tab  of  the document. A higher score implies higher severity and likelihood of the risk.
texts.text: Details from the 'Risk Identification' tab are auto imported into the 'Risk Assessment' tab. The survey participants assess the severity and likelihood of each risk in this tab. Detailed criteria  for  these  parameters  are  provided  in  the  'Risk  Assessment  Criteria'  tab  of  the document. A higher score implies higher severity and likelihood of the risk.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Details from the 'Risk Assessment' tabs are auto imported into the 'Risk Mitigation' tab. The survey participants identify an appropriate mitigation approach for each risk in this tab. The types of mitigation approaches are detailed in the 'Risk Mitigation Approaches' tab of the document.
texts.text: Details from the 'Risk Assessment' tabs are auto imported into the 'Risk Mitigation' tab. The survey participants identify an appropriate mitigation approach for each risk in this tab. texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Risk Register and Mitigation Tracker' document is reviewed and approved by 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA .  The 'Approvers' may consider (but not limited to) the following points while reviewing the document:
texts.text: The 'Risk Register and Mitigation Tracker' document is reviewed and approved by 'Approvers' designated as per the PDoA .  The 'Approvers' may consider (but not limited to) the following points while reviewing the document:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Check that the details provided for each risk are correct.
texts.text: Check that the details provided for each risk are correct.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Suggest modifications to any risk provided in the document, if required.
texts.text: Suggest modifications to any risk provided in the document, if required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Recommend marking additional risks as high priority risks or to remove risks from the list of identified high-priority risks, if required.
texts.text: Recommend marking additional risks as high priority risks or to remove risks from the list of identified high-priority risks, if required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Recommend assigning a high priority risk to another individual, if required.
texts.text: Recommend assigning a high priority risk to another individual, if required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. Recommend adding risks to the 'Risk Register and Mitigation Tracker' document, if required.
texts.text: Recommend adding risks to the 'Risk Register and Mitigation Tracker' document, if required.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If 'Approvers' recommend changes to the 'Risk Register and Mitigation Tracker' document, the 'Project Owner' makes the recommended modifications and re-submit it for approval.
texts.text: If 'Approvers' recommend changes to the 'Risk Register and Mitigation Tracker' document, the 'Project Owner' makes the recommended modifications and re-submit it for approval.

texts.orig: The Risk and Regulation Lead reviews and assess potential impacts of the upcoming regulation changes on Procurement .  In  case of potential impacts, the Risk and regulation Lead creates, manages, executes and closes the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change'.
texts.text: The Risk and Regulation Lead reviews and assess potential impacts of the upcoming regulation changes on Procurement .  In  case of potential impacts, the Risk and regulation Lead creates, manages, executes and closes the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Assigned Risk  and  Regulation  Lead creates  a  'Knowledge  Project  (Supply  Risk)  -  Regulation Change'  by  selecting  'Knowledge  Project'  from  the  'SAP  Ariba  Dashboard',  completing  the 'Overview  Form',  selecting  the  'Supply  Risk  Management'  template,  and  selecting  the 'Regulation Change' as the risk profiling type.
texts.text: Assigned Risk  and  Regulation  Lead creates  a  'Knowledge  Project  (Supply  Risk)  -  Regulation Change'  by  selecting  'Knowledge  Project'  from  the  'SAP  Ariba  Dashboard',  completing  the 'Overview  Form',  selecting  the  'Supply  Risk  Management'  template,  and  selecting  the 'Regulation Change' as the risk profiling type.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Assigned Risk and Regulation Lead from GPO may link the 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) Regulation  Change'  to  a  previously  executed  'Knowledge  Project  (Supply  Risk)  -  Regulation Change'  by  selecting  the  'Predecessor  Project'  field  in  the  'Overview  Form'.  This  helps  in indicating the relationship between projects in 'SAP Ariba'.

This  helps  in indicating the relationship between projects in 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  case,  the  'Knowledge  Project  (Supply  Risk)  -  Regulation  Change'  created  is  identical  (or similar) to a previously executed 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change', the assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead may use the 'Copy from Project' field to readily import (but not limited to) 'Overview Form' details, and if required, 'Project Groups' and documents from the previously executed project into the current project. This imported information is modifiable in the current 'Knowledge Project (Supply Risk) - Regulation Change'.

texts.orig: The  Supplier  Master  Data  Management  (Supplier  MDM)  process  group  consists  of  procedures associated with the creation and maintenance of the Supplier Master Database. It includes procedures for Supplier registration,  qualification,  disqualification,  deactivation,  and  reactivation.  The  Supplier Master Database contains unique record of each Supplier .
texts.text: The  Supplier  Master  Data  Management  (Supplier  MDM)  process  group  consists  of  procedures associated with the creation and maintenance of the Supplier Master Database. It includes procedures for Supplier registration,  qualification,  disqualification,  deactivation,  and  reactivation.  The  Supplier Master Database contains unique record of each Supplier .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the Supplier MDM processes.
texts.text: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the Supplier MDM processes.

texts.orig: The Registration Request enables Suppliers or Entities to raise the 'Registration Request'. It enables identification of duplicate requests.
texts.text: The Registration Request enables Suppliers or Entities to raise the 'Registration Request'. It enables identification of duplicate requests.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier Registration enables Suppliers to complete and submit the 'Registration Questionnaires' to be reviewed by the Supplier Registration Team . Registration of a Supplier in the Supplier Master Database is necessary for the Supplier to participate in Limited Tenders.
texts.text: The Supplier Registration enables Suppliers to complete and submit the 'Registration Questionnaires' to be reviewed by the Supplier Registration Team . Registration of a Supplier in the Supplier Master Database is necessary for the Supplier to participate in Limited Tenders.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier Qualification enables Suppliers to complete and submit the 'Qualification Questionnaire' to be reviewed by the Supplier Registration Team . Qualification of a Supplier in the Supplier Master Database is necessary for the Supplier to  conduct business activities, including (but not limited to) receiving award, PO and submitting invoices.
texts.text: The Supplier Qualification enables Suppliers to complete and submit the 'Qualification Questionnaire' to be reviewed by the Supplier Registration Team . Qualification of a Supplier in the Supplier Master Database is necessary for the Supplier to  conduct business activities, including (but not limited to) receiving award, PO and submitting invoices.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier Qualification also includes process to disqualify a Supplier , if required. Suppliers can be blacklisted through the disqualification process.
texts.text: The Supplier Qualification also includes process to disqualify a Supplier , if required. Suppliers can be blacklisted through the disqualification process.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier Deactivation/Reactivation enables the Supplier Registration Team to deactivate/reactivate the Suppliers , as required. A 'Deactivated' Supplier is not eligible to conduct any business activity or participate in any Limited Tender.
texts.text: The Supplier Deactivation/Reactivation enables the Supplier Registration Team to deactivate/reactivate the Suppliers , as required. A 'Deactivated' Supplier is not eligible to conduct any business activity or participate in any Limited Tender.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier onboarding process  starts  with  a  valid  'Registration  Request'.  The  purpose  of  this process  is  to  create,  review,  and  approve  the  'Registration  Request'  and  ensure  that Supplier records are not duplicated in the Supplier Master Database.
texts.text: The Supplier onboarding process  starts  with  a  valid  'Registration  Request'.  The  purpose  of  this process  is  to  create,  review,  and  approve  the  'Registration  Request'  and  ensure  that Supplier records are not duplicated in the Supplier Master Database.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. AD-DED Suppliers raise  a  'Supplier  Self-Registration Request' by opening the 'SAP Ariba Supplier Self-Registration Request link' and completing and submitting the 'SelfRegistration Request form'.
texts.text: AD-DED Suppliers raise  a  'Supplier  Self-Registration Request' by opening the 'SAP Ariba Supplier Self-Registration Request link' and completing and submitting the 'SelfRegistration Request form'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Non- AD-DED Suppliers request an Entity to raise an 'Entity Raised Supplier Request', on their behalf. In such cases, the Entity user logs into 'SAP Ariba Supplier Entity-Request Page', completes  and  submits  the  'Entity  Raised  Request  Form',  and  uploads  the  required documents.
texts.text: Non- AD-DED Suppliers request an Entity to raise an 'Entity Raised Supplier Request', on their behalf. In such cases, the Entity user logs into 'SAP Ariba Supplier Entity-Request Page', completes  and  submits  the  'Entity  Raised  Request  Form',  and  uploads  the  required documents.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Entity user should validate the information provided by the Supplier before submitting the request and confirm that the business requirements which are met by the Non - AD-DED Supplier cannot be met by a Supplier that holds an Abu Dhabi DED license.
texts.text: The Entity user should validate the information provided by the Supplier before submitting the request and confirm that the business requirements which are met by the Non - AD-DED Supplier cannot be met by a Supplier that holds an Abu Dhabi DED license.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Entity  user , while  completing  the  'Entity-Raised  Request  Form'  must  confirm  the expected spend with the Supplier . In case of Foreign Suppliers , this expected spend decides the attestation requirements.
texts.text: The  Entity  user , while  completing  the  'Entity-Raised  Request  Form'  must  confirm  the expected spend with the Supplier . In case of Foreign Suppliers , this expected spend decides the attestation requirements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier Registration Team Lead , upon receiving on the 'Registration Request', assigns the request to a Supplier Data Management Specialist for review and approval.
texts.text: The Supplier Registration Team Lead , upon receiving on the 'Registration Request', assigns the request to a Supplier Data Management Specialist for review and approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Supplier Data Management Specialist reviews the 'Registration Request' for the following:
texts.text: The Supplier Data Management Specialist reviews the 'Registration Request' for the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Duplicate  'Registration  Request'  'SAP  Ariba'  automatically  highlights  if  the  received 'Registration Request' is a duplicate and highlights potential matches using the following fields:
texts.text: Duplicate  'Registration  Request'  'SAP  Ariba'  automatically  highlights  if  the  received 'Registration Request' is a duplicate and highlights potential matches using the following fields:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case 'SAP Ariba' highlights potential matches for a 'Registration Request', the Supplier Data Management Specialist checks for the following points, across potential duplicates:
texts.text: In case 'SAP Ariba' highlights potential matches for a 'Registration Request', the Supplier Data Management Specialist checks for the following points, across potential duplicates:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Suppliers with the same 'Company Name' appear as potential matches in 'SAP Ariba' . In this case, the Supplier Data Management Specialist should compare the 'Commercial/Industrial License  Number'  and  'Tax  Registration  Number'  with  that  of  the  potential  matches  to determine if the 'Registration Request' is a duplicate.
texts.text: Suppliers with the same 'Company Name' appear as potential matches in 'SAP Ariba' . In this case, the Supplier Data Management Specialist should compare the 'Commercial/Industrial License  Number'  and  'Tax  Registration  Number'  with  that  of  the  potential  matches  to determine if the 'Registration Request' is a duplicate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Suppliers related to each other (e.g., parent and child companies) may have the same 'Tax Registration Number'. Such Suppliers appear as potential matches in 'SAP Ariba'. In such cases, the Supplier Data Management Specialist should compare the 'Commercial/Industrial License Number' with that of the potential matches to determine if the 'Registration Request' is a duplicate.
texts.text: Suppliers related to each other (e.g., parent and child companies) may have the same 'Tax Registration Number'. Such Suppliers appear as potential matches in 'SAP Ariba'. In such cases, the Supplier Data Management Specialist should compare the 'Commercial/Industrial License Number' with that of the potential matches to determine if the 'Registration Request' is a duplicate.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Important Note: Different 'Commercial/Industrial License Number' implies a different Supplier. A Supplier with multiple commercial/industrial licenses raises a separate 'Registration Request' for each of the commercial/industrial license.
texts.text: Important Note: Different 'Commercial/Industrial License Number' implies a different Supplier. A Supplier with multiple commercial/industrial licenses raises a separate 'Registration Request' for each of the commercial/industrial license.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Based on the above activities, the Supplier Data Management Specialist determines if the 'Registration Request' is a duplicate and reject the same in such cases. In case 'SAP Ariba' does not highlight a duplicate for a 'Registration Request', the Supplier Data Management Specialist proceeds to further evaluation of the 'Registration Request'.
texts.text: Based on the above activities, the Supplier Data Management Specialist determines if the 'Registration Request' is a duplicate and reject the same in such cases. In case 'SAP Ariba' does not highlight a duplicate for a 'Registration Request', the Supplier Data Management Specialist proceeds to further evaluation of the 'Registration Request'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Valid 'Registration Request' -  In  case  the  'Registration Request'  is  not  a  duplicate,  the Supplier  Data  Management  Specialist validates if  the  information  provided  in  the 'Registration Request' is accurate and matches the information in the documents provided .
texts.text: Valid 'Registration Request' -  In  case  the  'Registration Request'  is  not  a  duplicate,  the Supplier  Data  Management  Specialist validates if  the  information  provided  in  the 'Registration Request' is accurate and matches the information in the documents provided .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  case  the  'Registration  Request'  is  denied,  the Supplier  Data  Management  Specialist provides a valid rationale, and the Supplier or Entity may re-start the process.
texts.text: In  case  the  'Registration  Request'  is  denied,  the Supplier  Data  Management  Specialist provides a valid rationale, and the Supplier or Entity may re-start the process.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If the details provided in the 'Registration Request' are found accurate, the Supplier Data Management Specialist approves the request and assigns himself/herself as the 'Supplier Manager ' for the Supplier .  The 'Supplier Manager ' acts as the single point of contact for the Supplier during the registration and qualification processes.
texts.text: If the details provided in the 'Registration Request' are found accurate, the Supplier Data Management Specialist approves the request and assigns himself/herself as the 'Supplier Manager ' for the Supplier .  The 'Supplier Manager ' acts as the single point of contact for the Supplier during the registration and qualification processes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As soon as the 'Registration Request' is 'Approved', the Supplier receives an invitation to register with 'SAP Ariba Network'. This email includes the 'SAP Ariba Registration Link'.
texts.text: As soon as the 'Registration Request' is 'Approved', the Supplier receives an invitation to register with 'SAP Ariba Network'. This email includes the 'SAP Ariba Registration Link'.

texts.orig: Important  Note:  In  case  the  'Registration  Request'  is  raised  by  the  Entity,  the  Entity  users  is notified about the request status (approval/denied).
texts.text: Important  Note:  In  case  the  'Registration  Request'  is  raised  by  the  Entity,  the  Entity  users  is notified about the request status (approval/denied).

texts.orig: AD-DED  Suppliers are  'Registered'  for  all  Entities.  While Non  -  AD-DED  Suppliers are 'Registered' for the Entity raising the 'Entity Raised Request' for the Supplier .  'Registered' Suppliers can participate in tenders across Entities and categories.
texts.text: AD-DED  Suppliers are  'Registered'  for  all  Entities.  While Non  -  AD-DED  Suppliers are 'Registered' for the Entity raising the 'Entity Raised Request' for the Supplier .  'Registered' Suppliers can participate in tenders across Entities and categories.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  'Supplier  Manager'  completes  the  'Pre-Qualification  Questionnaire'  and  specifies  the 'Category', 'Region' and 'Entity' for which the Supplier is to be 'Qualified'.
texts.text: The  'Supplier  Manager'  completes  the  'Pre-Qualification  Questionnaire'  and  specifies  the 'Category', 'Region' and 'Entity' for which the Supplier is to be 'Qualified'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Supplier Manager'  sends  the  'Qualification Questionnaire'  to the Supplier . The 'Qualification  Questionnaire'  contains  sections  for  the Supplier to  provide  declarations  with respect to 'Business Standing', 'Financial Standing', and 'Previous Experience'.
texts.text: The 'Supplier Manager'  sends  the  'Qualification Questionnaire'  to the Supplier . The 'Qualification  Questionnaire'  contains  sections  for  the Supplier to  provide  declarations  with respect to 'Business Standing', 'Financial Standing', and 'Previous Experience'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suppliers can be 'Qualified' for multiple categories using a single 'Qualification Questionnaire'. In the 'Pre -Qualification Questionnaire', the 'Supplier Manager' has an option to add multiple categories in the 'Category' field.
texts.text: Suppliers can be 'Qualified' for multiple categories using a single 'Qualification Questionnaire'. In the 'Pre -Qualification Questionnaire', the 'Supplier Manager' has an option to add multiple categories in the 'Category' field.

texts.text: The Supplier receives and responds to all sections in the 'Qualification Questionnaire'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The responses to 'Qualification Questionnaire' are reviewed by the 'Supplier Manager' and, subsequently, the Supplier Data Management Lead . The Supplier status changes to 'Qualified' (automatically)  once  the  'Qualification  Questionnaire'  is  'Approved'  by  the Supplier  Data Management Lead.
texts.text: The responses to 'Qualification Questionnaire' are reviewed by the 'Supplier Manager' and, subsequently, the Supplier Data Management Lead . The Supplier status changes to 'Qualified' (automatically)  once  the  'Qualification  Questionnaire'  is  'Approved'  by  the Supplier  Data Management Lead.

texts.text: The 'Supplier Manager' (or Supplier Data Management Lead ) may ask the Supplier for more information while reviewing the 'Qualification Questionnaire' through the 'Request Additional Info' functionality in 'SAP Ariba'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Supplier Manager' may provide an 'Expiry Date' for the 'Qualified' status of the Supplier , in line with the commercial/industrial license expiration date. In such a case, once the 'Expiry Date' has passed, the Supplier status changes to 'Qualification Expired'.
texts.text: The 'Supplier Manager' may provide an 'Expiry Date' for the 'Qualified' status of the Supplier , in line with the commercial/industrial license expiration date. In such a case, once the 'Expiry Date' has passed, the Supplier status changes to 'Qualification Expired'.

texts.label: text

texts.text: Suppliers can be blacklisted using disqualification functionality.

texts.label: text

texts.text: The Entity user can create the 'Supplier Disqualification Survey' from the 'SAP Ariba dashboard' to request blacklisting of a Supplier.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Supplier Manager' can disqualify a Supplier through the ' Supplier profile' page provided in  'SAP  Ariba'.  The  'Supplier  Manager'  provides  a  'Disqualification  Start  Date'  and  a 'Disqualification End Date' while disqualifying a Supplier . When the 'Disqualification Expiry Date' has passed, the 'Supplier Manager' may re-initiate the qualification process for the Supplier, as explained above.
texts.text: The 'Supplier Manager' can disqualify a Supplier through the ' Supplier profile' page provided in  'SAP  Ariba'.  The  'Supplier  Manager'  provides  a  'Disqualification  Start  Date'  and  a 'Disqualification End Date' while disqualifying a Supplier . When the 'Disqualification Expiry Date' has passed, the 'Supplier Manager' may re-initiate the qualification process for the Supplier, as explained above.

texts.label: text

texts.text: The guidelines for Supplier blacklisting are provided in section 12 of the Procurement Standards.

texts.orig: The assigned Supplier Data Management Specialist conducts quarterly reviews of the Supplier Master Database and identify Suppliers with expired commercial/industrial license .
texts.text: The assigned Supplier Data Management Specialist conducts quarterly reviews of the Supplier Master Database and identify Suppliers with expired commercial/industrial license .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Suppliers with expired commercial/industrial license receive an email requesting to renew the license. The email mentions that if the renewed license is not reflected in 'SAP Ariba' before the next quarterly review, the Supplier may be 'Deactivated'.
texts.text: The Suppliers with expired commercial/industrial license receive an email requesting to renew the license. The email mentions that if the renewed license is not reflected in 'SAP Ariba' before the next quarterly review, the Supplier may be 'Deactivated'.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case the assigned Supplier Data Management Specialist identifies a Supplier with an expired commercial/industrial license in the next quarterly review as well (even after reminder), the 'Supplier Manager' may 'Deactivate' the Supplier and provide a valid justification for the same.
texts.text: In case the assigned Supplier Data Management Specialist identifies a Supplier with an expired commercial/industrial license in the next quarterly review as well (even after reminder), the 'Supplier Manager' may 'Deactivate' the Supplier and provide a valid justification for the same.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Deactivated' status implies that the 'SAP Ariba' profile of the Supplier is  no  longer  active. Suppliers in 'Deactivated' status are not visible in any search list, cannot participate in tenders, and cannot be awarded.
texts.text: 'Deactivated' status implies that the 'SAP Ariba' profile of the Supplier is  no  longer  active. Suppliers in 'Deactivated' status are not visible in any search list, cannot participate in tenders, and cannot be awarded.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All existing contracts with the Supplier must be terminated before deactivating a Supplier .
texts.text: All existing contracts with the Supplier must be terminated before deactivating a Supplier .

texts.label: text

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Item Master Data Management (Item MDM) process group consists of procedures associated with the creation and maintenance of records of items representing unique goods/services. The Item Master Data provides accurate, consistent and complete record of goods/services procured across Entities. The responsibility for maintaining Item Master Data is centralized with changes to the records initiated by the Entities.
texts.text: Item Master Data Management (Item MDM) process group consists of procedures associated with the creation and maintenance of records of items representing unique goods/services. The Item Master Data provides accurate, consistent and complete record of goods/services procured across Entities. The responsibility for maintaining Item Master Data is centralized with changes to the records initiated by the Entities.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Following  guidelines  must  be  adhered  to  during  creation  and  maintenance  of  the  Item  Master Database:
texts.text: Following  guidelines  must  be  adhered  to  during  creation  and  maintenance  of  the  Item  Master Database:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1) Records of Item Master Data are created for frequently purchased goods/services.
texts.text: Records of Item Master Data are created for frequently purchased goods/services.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2) Each item is identified by a unique code in the Item Master Data.
texts.text: Each item is identified by a unique code in the Item Master Data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3) The record of each item contains (but not limited to):
texts.text: The record of each item contains (but not limited to):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4) Each item belongs to one of the UNSPSC Level 3 'Classes'. UNSPSC classification is explained in section 1.2.2 .
texts.text: Each item belongs to one of the UNSPSC Level 3 'Classes'. UNSPSC classification is explained in section 1.2.2 .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5) Item Master Database is regularly cleansed to identify and remove duplicate records and rectify incomplete and inconsistent records, to ensure data integrity.
texts.text: Item Master Database is regularly cleansed to identify and remove duplicate records and rectify incomplete and inconsistent records, to ensure data integrity.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Entity requestor can raise a request to add/modify an item record in the Item Master Data though GPO Helpdesk. The raised request must be approved by the supervisor of the requestor. The Helpdesk forwards the request to the Item Master Data team.
texts.text: Entity requestor can raise a request to add/modify an item record in the Item Master Data though GPO Helpdesk. The raised request must be approved by the supervisor of the requestor. The Helpdesk forwards the request to the Item Master Data team.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Item Master Data team reviews the raised request for completeness, accuracy, and duplication.
texts.text: The Item Master Data team reviews the raised request for completeness, accuracy, and duplication.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case the request is duplicate, the Item Master Data team rejects the request and communicate the same to the GPO helpdesk. The GPO helpdesk communicates the same to the Entity requestor.
texts.text: In case the request is duplicate, the Item Master Data team rejects the request and communicate the same to the GPO helpdesk. The GPO helpdesk communicates the same to the Entity requestor.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  case  the  request  if  inaccurate  or  incomplete,  the  Item  Master  Data  team  seeks  additional information from the Entity requestor (through Helpdesk).
texts.text: In  case  the  request  if  inaccurate  or  incomplete,  the  Item  Master  Data  team  seeks  additional information from the Entity requestor (through Helpdesk).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  case  the  request  is  accurate,  complete,  and  valid,  the  Item  Master  Data  team  obtains  required approvals as per the PDoA to create/modify/delete the record, depending upon the request. Once approved,  the  Item  Master  Data  completes  executes  the  request  in  the  Item  master  Data  and communicates the same to the GPO Helpdesk. The GPO Helpdesk communicates the completion of request to the Entity requestor.
texts.text: If  case  the  request  is  accurate,  complete,  and  valid,  the  Item  Master  Data  team  obtains  required approvals as per the PDoA to create/modify/delete the record, depending upon the request. Once approved,  the  Item  Master  Data  completes  executes  the  request  in  the  Item  master  Data  and communicates the same to the GPO Helpdesk. The GPO Helpdesk communicates the completion of request to the Entity requestor.

texts.orig: User Master Data Management (User MDM) process group consists of procedures associated with the enablement, modification and deactivation of users in 'SAP Ariba'. It also describes the procedure for resetting the 'SAP Ariba' account password and user delegation.
texts.text: User Master Data Management (User MDM) process group consists of procedures associated with the enablement, modification and deactivation of users in 'SAP Ariba'. It also describes the procedure for resetting the 'SAP Ariba' account password and user delegation.

texts.orig: This section explains the activities, decisions involved, documents and templates used, the outcomes, and the stakeholders involved in the User MDM processes.

texts.text: The User MDM process group is enabled through the 'SAP Ariba - Core Administration' functionality. A 'User Enablement Team' (part of the GPO) executes User MDM processes in 'SAP Ariba', for all Entities.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Entity requestor raises the request to enable/modify/deactivate user by completing the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form'. The 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' can be downloaded from 'Abu Dhabi Procurements Portal'.
texts.text: Entity requestor raises the request to enable/modify/deactivate user by completing the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form'. The 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' can be downloaded from 'Abu Dhabi Procurements Portal'.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2) Obtain approvals for the raised request
texts.text: 2) Obtain approvals for the raised request

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Entity requestor sends the completed 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' to the Head of Procurement for review and approval.
texts.text: Entity requestor sends the completed 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' to the Head of Procurement for review and approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If the Head of Procurement rejects the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form', a valid justification must be provided to the 'Requestor'. The 'Requestor' makes the recommended modifications and re-submits the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' for approval.
texts.text: If the Head of Procurement rejects the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form', a valid justification must be provided to the 'Requestor'. The 'Requestor' makes the recommended modifications and re-submits the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Entity requestor submits the approved 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' in 'Abu Dhabi Procurements Portal' for review and approval by the 'GPO Approver'. If the ' GPO Approver ' rejects  the  'SAP  Ariba  Enablement  Form',  a  valid  justification  must  be  provided  to  the 'Requestor'. The 'Requestor' makes the recommended modifications and re-submits the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' for approval.
texts.text: Entity requestor submits the approved 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' in 'Abu Dhabi Procurements Portal' for review and approval by the 'GPO Approver'. If the ' GPO Approver ' rejects  the  'SAP  Ariba  Enablement  Form',  a  valid  justification  must  be  provided  to  the 'Requestor'. The 'Requestor' makes the recommended modifications and re-submits the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form' for approval.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: After the 'GPO Approver' approves the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form', the 'User Enablement Team' is notified through a system-generated email.
texts.text: After the 'GPO Approver' approves the 'SAP Ariba Enablement Form', the 'User Enablement Team' is notified through a system-generated email.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The assigned team member from the 'User Enablement Team' takes the required actions in 'SAP  Ariba'  and  closes  the  request  in  'Abu  Dhabi  Procurements  Portal'  which  triggers  a notification email for the 'Requestor' informing completion of the raised request.
texts.text: The assigned team member from the 'User Enablement Team' takes the required actions in 'SAP  Ariba'  and  closes  the  request  in  'Abu  Dhabi  Procurements  Portal'  which  triggers  a notification email for the 'Requestor' informing completion of the raised request.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Entity requestor sends an email to the GPO Helpdesk requesting delegation of 'SAP Ariba' access to another user or a password reset.
texts.text: The Entity requestor sends an email to the GPO Helpdesk requesting delegation of 'SAP Ariba' access to another user or a password reset.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The GPO Helpdesk forwards the request to the 'User Enablement Team' via email. The 'User Enablement Team' takes the required action in 'SAP Ariba' and confirms the closure of the request to GPO Helpdesk. The GPO Helpdesk confirms the same to the Entity requestor.
texts.text: The GPO Helpdesk forwards the request to the 'User Enablement Team' via email. The 'User Enablement Team' takes the required action in 'SAP Ariba' and confirms the closure of the request to GPO Helpdesk. The GPO Helpdesk confirms the same to the Entity requestor.

texts.label: text

texts.text: In case of a delegation request, the 'User Enablement Team' sends an email to the delegatee (person to whom responsibilities have been delegated to) with details of the delegation.

table_cells.text: Reduction for less' Cost Avoidance 'avoiding future cost'
Definition  One - time impact of increased cash
Benefits that directly reduce the cost base compared to the baseline  Costs can be one-offs or recurring/sustainable
Cost was not included in the original baseline  Action taken now to avoid future incremental costs  Could include initiatives that lead to cost reduction in the future
Example  Cash impact due outstanding payables with Supplier (increased 'Payment Terms')  Sale or decrease inventory
Reduction in cost of software licenses resulting from optimization  A one-time saving such as a rebate or volume reduction in the prior year.

Consumption reduced because of increase in efficiency or optimization  Price increase as a result of external factors, e.g. an increase in regulatory minimum wage, is offset by a reduced agency fee mark-up
Measurement  One - time impact demonstrated by estimating benefits.
Hard benefits (savings or additional revenue) vs Baseline Spend  Spend reduction year-over- year
No increase in year-over-year spend particular to the relevant cost avoidance initiative (e.g., demand optimization)  Cost avoidance demonstrated by comparing the variance in volume and price.

table_cells.text: 100% of forecast volume for the specific spend area

50% of historic volume + (50% of historic volume * category demand growth forecast %) In general, previous year volumes are used as historic volumes; if this data is not available, the period that is used to calculate historic volume should be mentioned.

grid.text: 100% of forecast volume for the specific spend area

50% of historic volume + (50% of historic volume * category demand growth forecast %) In general, previous year volumes are used as historic volumes; if this data is not available, the period that is used to calculate historic volume should be mentioned.

table_cells.text: Used where market is not volatile (applicable for components and traded items like office furniture, etc.).
Last actual paid price in the Purchase Order (PO), or  Contracted price, if last actual paid price is not available
Used in case of a volatile market (applicable for e.g., 100% index-based commodities)
Average Price paid over the last year
Used in case of a volatile market (Commodities for which transparent and independent index are not available)
Average Price of historical offers after clarification from the Suppliers

grid.text: Used where market is not volatile (applicable for components and traded items like office furniture, etc.).

table_cells.text: To provide category definition, category tree and any other relevant information
To provide details of the typical value chain of the category

This section provides insights including but not limited to historic and expected demand, key demand segments, the composition of demand and growth trends, unit price and price movement, policies and other Govt. mandates that impact demand.

This section provides details including but not limited to the market size, overall industry capacity, key Suppliers , their market share, market growth in the last few years, market trends, mergers and acquisitions. It covers Porter's five forces analysis (buyer power, supplier power, threat to new entrants, substitutes, and industry rivalry).

This section provides details of the Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) of the category. TCO is a methodology to calculate (over the lifecycle of a goods/service) the overall cost including but not limited to unit cost, logistics, maintenance, warranty, insurance, wear and tear, administrative, taxes and overheads. TCO provides visibility on cost heads, helping estimate potential areas of cost improvement which can generate savings and spend optimization opportunities.
To provide details of the key suppliers, brands, products available in the geography.

table_cells.text: Abu Dhabi Department of Economic Development

grid.text: Abu Dhabi Department of Economic Development

table_cells.text: Digital Marketplace presenting information, enabling access to procurement services and consolidating information across all Entities.
A system role assigned for reviewing and approving/denying documents/tasks as per the Procurement Delegation of Authority (PDoA).
A system role assigned for validating the information provided in the 'Payment and Bank Questionnaire'.
Addressable spend against which any benefit is measured.
A bank guarantee submitted with bids to assure serious participation in the tender.
A functionality within "SAP Ariba" (for eAuctions) to receive and monitor commercial bids.
A business role accountable for spending decisions of the section/department.
A database of goods/services/projects readily available for raising a PR.
A strategic approach to procurement by segmenting spend into categories for driving savings, consolidation and efficiency.
Envelope enabled in 'SAP Ariba' Sourcing Event to record and evaluate Suppliers' commercial responses.
Category procured by five or more Entities.
A folder within the "Contract Workspace" where all relevant documents related to the contract are stored.
"SAP Ariba" Project Group including Contract Specialist/Contract Lead assigned for creating and managing the "Contract Workspace".
"SAP Ariba" workspace (within 'SAP Ariba' CLM module) where activities related to creating, publishing, managing and closing contracts are executed.
The requesters or requesting parties of goods, services and projects.
Local departments and every juridical person reporting to the Government and having full legal capacity to act and manage a public facility or aiming to provide a public service.
Category procured by less than five Entities
The function within the government entity dedicated to financial affairs.

table_cells.text: Type of the 'Sourcing Project' preferred for strategic sourcing initiatives requiring creation of 'Sourcing Strategy'.
A document issued to acknowledge the receipt of goods/services/projects.
Individual assigned to lead the procurement unit.
The function within the government entity dedicated to legal affairs.
A tendering method that is open to predefined number of registered Suppliers.
Goods/services not part of the Catalogue.
Terms specifying the number of days available and other conditions for transferring the payment of accepted goods/services/projects to the Supplier.
Corporate card issued to authorized employees for making electronic payments for goods/service/projects.
A bank guarantee provided by the supplier or contractor to secure good performance and compliance with of the contract terms and conditions.
Small amounts of discretionary funds in the form of cash (defined in the PDoA) used for expenditures.
The procurement function existing within or outside the government entity.
Benefits that result in Cost Reduction, Cost Avoidance, and Cash Impact for procurement.
A formal document defining the roles and committees required for the procurement operations.
A formal document defining division of authority and powers in the government entity related to procurement operations.
A set of interrelated documents devised to help procurement professionals in their work.
An integrated set of principles that harmonize the way of working, establish a unified operating model and define the performance of the Procurement.
The groups of participants involved in the design and execution of various activities within 'SAP Ariba' projects (e.g. "Sourcing Project", "Contract Workspace").
A system role assigned for execution of 'SAP Ariba' projects (e.g. "Sourcing Project", "Contract Workspace").
A tendering method that is open to all Suppliers, and where the bids are invited through public announcements.

table_cells.text: A legally binding document issued by the government entity to Suppliers in reference to the Contract or the Price List Agreement or on a standalone basis, indicating key parameters of purchase such as quantities, agreed prices, delivery schedule, payment terms and other relevant information and committing both parties upon explicit or implicit confirmation by Supplier.
A request generated by an End-User for securing goods/services/projects.
Type of the 'Sourcing Project' preferred for non-strategic sourcing initiative without 'Sourcing Strategy'.
Sourcing Event used for screening Suppliers and gathering information or budget estimates from a broad base of potential Suppliers.
Sourcing Event used for seeking technical and commercial proposals from Suppliers.
Sourcing Event used for seeking pricing information for a defined scope of work or supply of specified goods or services.
Any government employee raising a request for goods/services/projects or other services provided by the GPO.

Sourcing Event used for seeking competitive bids in real time for highly commoditized goods, services and projects where specifications have already been fully acknowledged by participating Suppliers.
A system role assigned for reviewing documents/tasks as per the Procurement Delegation of Authority (PDoA).
'SAP Ariba' home screen available after login, providing navigation elements, common actions, and relevant content based on user role.
A free business-to-business (B2B) marketplace designed to connect buyers and suppliers.
A document issued to acknowledge the completion of a service.
A tendering method that is open to only one qualified Supplier capable of supplying the required goods, services and projects or a single Supplier is selected from a pool of qualified Suppliers.
Repository of standard (best practice) documents, templates and questions that may be used in a Sourcing Event.
"SAP Ariba" workspace for conducting sourcing activities and awarding Suppliers.

An individual or an organization engaged to supply the goods, services or projects.
A system role assigned for registering and qualifying Suppliers.
The groups of participants pre-determined in 'SAP Ariba' for reviews and approvals as per the Procurement Delegation of Authority (PDoA).
A system role assigned for reviewing 'Sourcing Strategy' and performing evaluation of Sourcing Event.
A single envelop enabled in 'SAP Ariba' for obtaining technical and commercial bids together.
Envelope enabled in 'SAP Ariba' for obtaining technical bids separately.
A committee established to evaluate the results of relevant tenders and encourage cross-functional collaboration.
A team in the GPO responsible for implementing requests in 'SAP Ariba' related to the user enablement, modification, delegation and deletion.
